TRIBAL ARCHIVES - SISSETON WAHPETON OYATE [THE SISSETON WAHPETON OYATE TRIBAL ARCHIVES COLLECTS, PROCESSES AND PRESERVES ALL RECORDS, WRITTEN AND ORAL, BOTH PAST AND PRESENT, CONCERNING THE SISSETON WAHPETON OYATE (SWO) TRIBE. THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC SEVERELY DISRUPTED THE WORK OF THE SWO TRIBAL ARCHIVES AND THE TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE. AS OF MAY 2021, BOTH OFFICES CONTINUE TO WORK AT A LIMITED CAPACITY IN RESPONSE TO TRIBAL RESTRICTIONS, WHICH ARE MORE CAUTIOUS THAN BOTH STATE AND FEDERAL GUIDELINES. PRIOR TO THE PANDEMIC, SWO TRIBAL ARCHIVES AND TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE REGULARLY HOSTED TOURS WITH SCHOOLCHILDREN, SHARING THE RICH HISTORY OF THE DAKOTA WITH NEW GENERATIONS FROM ACROSS SOUTH AND NORTH DAKOTA. UNFORTUNATELY, AT THIS TIME, VISITORS ARE STILL PROHIBITED. NEH FUNDS WILL JUMPSTART STALLED EFFORTS TO ORGANIZE ARCHIVE COLLECTIONS, DIGITIZE DOCUMENTS AND ARTIFACTS, CREATE A SEARCHABLE CATALOGUE, AND BUILD EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES FOR VISITORS, REGAINING GROUND LOST DUE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS&NBSP;TO STRENGTHEN ARCHIVAL PRESERVATION AND DIGITIZATION AT THE&NBSP;SISSETON WAHPETON OYATE TRIBAL ARCHIVES IN SOUTH DAKOTA.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE&NBSP;PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT FUNDS&NBSP;NEW STAFF WHO WILL ORGANIZE ARCHIVAL COLLECTIONS, DIGITIZE DOCUMENTS AND ARTIFACTS, CREATE A SEARCHABLE CATALOG, AND BUILD EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES FOR VISITORS.&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THIS GRANT WOULD ALLOW THE&NBSP;ARCHIVES TO JUMPSTART THEIR COLLECTIONS AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING WORK THAT HAS BEEN DELAYED BY THE EFFECTS OF THE PANDEMIC.&NBSP;RENEWED ARCHIVAL WORK WOULD GIVE THE TRIBAL ARCHIVES THE CAPACITY TO RESTRUCTURE PRESERVATION EFFORTS TO BETTER SERVE THE PUBLIC.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT&NBSP;THE&NBSP;SISSETON WAHPETON OYATE PEOPLE IN SOUTH DAKOTA AND NORTH DAKOTA WHO ARE UNABLE TO VISIT THE ARCHIVES IN PERSON DUE TO THE PANDEMIC.&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

ENHANCING ACCESS AND PRESERVATION AT THE GREAT PLAINS ART MUSEUM [GREAT PLAINS ART MUSEUM (GPAM) IS REQUESTING $177,000 IN GRANT FUNDING FROM THE NEH-ARP TO START PHASE 1 OF OUR DIGITIZATION PROJECT: THE CREATION OF APPROXIMATELY 2,000 DIGITAL IMAGES OF ARTWORK IN OUR PERMANENT COLLECTIONS. DIGITIZING THESE ARTWORKS WILL ENABLE US TO CREATE VIRTUAL EXHIBITIONS AND PROGRAMS THAT HIGHLIGHT SPECIFIC THEMES AND PARALLEL WHAT IS ON VIEW IN THE MUSEUM. FOR EXAMPLE, DIGITIZED IMAGES OF THE INDIGENOUS ART IN OUR COLLECTION WILL INCREASE ACCESS TO AND EXPAND THE IMPACT OF OUR NATIVE AMERICAN ART FROM THE PERMANENT COLLECTION EXHIBITION OPENING FALL 2021. WE ALSO PLAN TO DEVELOP IN PERSON AND VIRTUAL EDUCATION AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS AIMED AT ADDRESSING CONTEMPORARY ISSUES ON THE GREAT PLAINS BY USING ART AS A LEARNING TOOL. ADDITIONALLY, BY COLLABORATING WITH UNL LIBRARIES, WE WILL SHARE OUR COLLECTION MORE WIDELY THROUGH AN ONLINE DATABASE TO AUDIENCES AND RESEARCHERS ACROSS THE WORLD.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO&NBSP;FUND STAFFING TO INCREASE THE COLLECTIONS DIGITIZATION EFFORTS OF&NBSP;AN&NBSP;ART MUSEUM AT THE UNIVERSITY OF NEBRASKA.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT FUNDS&NBSP;STAFF AND CONTRACTORS TO DIGITIZE OVER 2,000 WORKS OF ART AND TO DEVELOP IN-PERSON AND VIRTUAL EDUCATION AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS&NBSP;USING ART AS A TOOL FOR HUMANITIES EDUCATION.&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THIS GRANT WOULD ALLOW THE MUSEUM TO INCREASE ACCESS TO AND EXPAND THE IMPACT OF&NBSP;THEIR NATIVE AMERICAN ART COLLECTION&NBSP;EXHIBITION OPENING IN FALL 2021, AND ENABLE THEM TO CREATE VIRTUAL EXHIBITIONS AND PROGRAMS THAT HIGHLIGHT SPECIFIC THEMES AND PARALLEL WHAT IS ON VIEW IN THE MUSEUM.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT&NBSP;A BROAD AUDIENCE BY INCREASING WIDE ACCESS TO THEIR ONLINE DATABASE TO AUDIENCES AND RESEARCHERS ACROSS THE WORLD.&NBSP;&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

THE "GETTING WORD" ORAL HISTORY PROJECT AT MONTICELLO: "AN ARCHIVE OF BLACK FREEDOM" [THE "GETTING WORD" AFRICAN AMERICAN ORAL HISTORY PROJECT IS A UNIQUE ARCHIVE OF ORAL HISTORIES AND ASSOCIATED RESEARCH FILES OF FAMILIES WHOSE ANCESTORS WERE ENSLAVED BY THOMAS JEFFERSON, OR WHO LIVED AT MONTICELLO AFTER HIS DEATH DURING THE LEVY PERIOD OF OWNERSHIP (1836?1923). THE PROJECT DOCUMENTS THE HISTORY ? AND HUMANITY ? OF THE PEOPLE WHO LIVED IN SLAVERY ON THE MONTICELLO MOUNTAINTOP, AND CHRONICLES A STRUGGLE FOR FREEDOM ACROSS GENERATIONS OF DESCENDANTS, FROM THE CIVIL WAR TO THE CIVIL RIGHTS MOVEMENT. ONE FAMILY DESCENDANT CITES "GETTING WORD" AS AN IMPORTANT "ARCHIVE OF BLACK FREEDOM" STRETCHING FROM JEFFERSON'S LIFETIME TO THE PRESENT DAY. THE WORK TO MIGRATE THE ORAL HISTORY ARCHIVE ONTO AN ACCESSIBLE DIGITAL PLATFORM HAS BEEN SUSPENDED DUE TO THE PANDEMIC, WEAKENING MONTICELLO?S ABILITY TO COMMEMORATE THE NATION?S 250TH AS WE WISH AND WE MUST, WITH THE FULLEST POSSIBLE PICTURE OF OUR NATION?S FOUNDING -- THROUGH THE LENS OF THOSE DENIED THE PROMISE OF THE DECLARATION.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO&NBSP;CREATE A NEW DIGITAL PLATFORM FOR AN AFRICAN-AMERICAN ORAL HISTORY PROJECT ON THE DESCENDANTS OF THE ENSLAVED AT THOMAS&NBSP;JEFFERSON?S MONTICELLO&NBSP;IN CHARLOTTESVILLE, VIRGINIA.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE&NBSP;PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT FUNDS&NBSP;PROJECT AND INTERPRETATION STAFF TO&NBSP;MIGRATE THE ORAL HISTORY ARCHIVE ONTO AN ACCESSIBLE DIGITAL PLATFORM.&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THIS GRANT WOULD ALLOW STAFF TO CONTINUE MAKING THESE ORAL HISTORIES ACCESSIBLE TO THE PUBLIC ONLINE, AN EFFORT THAT HAD BEEN SUSPENDED DUE TO THE PANDEMIC.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE DESCENDANTS OF THOSE ENSLAVED AT MONTICELLO AS WELL AS RESEARCHERS OF AMERICAN&NBSP;AND AFRICAN-AMERICAN&NBSP;HISTORY.&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

VINDICATING EVIDENCES OF BLACK ACHIEVEMENT & HISTORY: ONSITE DIGITIZATION AT SCHOMBURG CENTER FOR RESEARCH IN BLACK CULTURE [THE NEW YORK PUBLIC LIBRARY (NYPL) REQUESTS FUNDING FROM THE NEH AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN TO: 1) SUPPORT THE CREATION OF A NEW SATELLITE DIGITAL IMAGING UNIT AT THE SCHOMBURG CENTER FOR RESEARCH IN BLACK CULTURE; 2) CREATE TWO TEMPORARY FULL-TIME STAFF POSITIONS TO FACILITATE THE PHOTOGRAPHY OF COLLECTION ITEMS FOR DIGITIZATION; AND 3) PROVIDE SALARY SUPPORT FOR AN EXISTING SCHOMBURG STAFF MEMBER WHO WILL SPEND THE MAJORITY OF THEIR TIME ON THIS EFFORT. THIS PROJECT WILL DRAMATICALLY INCREASE THE LIBRARY'S ABILITY TO PROVIDE RESPONSIVE, ON-DEMAND DIGITIZATION OF THE SCHOMBURG CENTER'S COLLECTION, WHICH ILLUMINATES THE LIVES OF MANY OF THE FIGURES WHO WORKED TO FORM 'A MORE PERFECT UNION.' THE PROJECT IS A SIGNIFICANT INVESTMENT IN THE WORK TO RENDER BLACK LIVES VISIBLE.] [PURPOSE:'THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO&NBSP;SUPPORT A NEW DIGITAL IMAGING STUDIO AT THE NEW YORK PUBLIC LIBRARY&NBSP;WHICH WILL&NBSP;EXPAND&NBSP;THEIR&NBSP;DIGITIZED COLLECTION OF AFRICAN-AMERICAN, AFRICAN, AND AFRICAN DIASPORIC MATERIALS.&NBSP;  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT FUNDS&NBSP;THE CREATION OF A SATELLITE DIGITAL IMAGING UNIT AND NEW STAFF MEMBERS TO INCREASE THEIR CAPACITY TO PHOTOGRAPH AND DIGITIZE AFRICAN&NBSP;AMERICAN COLLECTIONS.&NBSP;  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:'THIS GRANT WOULD INCREASE THE LIBRARY'S ABILITY TO&NBSP;PROVIDE RESPONSIVE, ON-DEMAND DIGITIZATION OF THEIR AFRICAN AMERICAN COLLECTIONS.&NBSP;  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT RESEARCHERS OF AFRICAN, AFRICAN DIASPORIC, AND AFRICAN AMERICAN CULTURE, AND ALL WHO WISH TO LEARN ABOUT THIS HISTORY OF BLACK LIVES IN THE UNITED STATES.&NBSP;  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

THE HULA PRESERVATION SOCIETY ARCHIVE - RISING TO MEET THE CHALLENGE [THE HPS ARCHIVE IS A UNIQUE REPOSITORY FILLED WITH THE VOICES OF OUR NATIVE HAWAIIAN ELDERS BORN PRIMARILY IN THE 1920S. THE PANDEMIC HAS NECESSITATED A STRENGTHENING AND UPDATING OF OUR CORE PROCESSES, DIGITIZATION STRATEGIES, AND PRESERVATION INFRASTRUCTURE. THROUGH THE THREE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT, HPS WILL MODERNIZE AND STREAMLINE 10 KEY ARCHIVAL OPERATIONS, DIGITIZE 175 OLD-FORMAT AUDIO AND VIDEO RESOURCES DATING BACK TO THE TIME OF THE HAWAIIAN RENAISSANCE THAT HAVE LONG BEEN UNADDRESSED, AND EXPAND THE CAPACITY OF BOTH OUR PRIMARY ARCHIVAL SERVER AND ITS BACKUP FOR LONG-TERM DIGITAL ASSET PRESERVATION.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT&NBSP;IS TO MODERNIZE AND IMPROVE ARCHIVAL OPERATIONS FOR A NATIVE HAWAIIAN HISTORICAL SOCIETY&NBSP;ON THE ISLAND OF&NBSP;O?AHU.&NBSP;&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT&NBSP;RETAINS STAFF WHO WILL MODERNIZE AND STREAMLINE KEY ARCHIVAL OPERATIONS, DIGITIZE OLD-FORMAT AUDIO AND VIDEO RESOURCES DATING BACK TO THE TIME OF THE HAWAIIAN RENAISSANCE THAT HAVE LONG BEEN UNADDRESSED, AND&NBSP;TO&NBSP;EXPAND THE CAPACITY OF BOTH&NBSP;THE&NBSP;PRIMARY ARCHIVAL SERVER AND ITS BACKUP FOR LONG-TERM DIGITAL ASSET PRESERVATION.&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THIS GRANT WOULD&NBSP;ENSURE THAT THE HISTORICAL SOCIETY HAS THE CAPACITY TO MEET THE GOALS OF ITS PREVIOUS PRESERVATION ASSESSMENT FROM&NBSP;AN NEH GRANT TO PRESERVE MATERIALS DONATED&NBSP;BY NATIVE HAWAIIAN ELDERS IN URGENT NEED OF PRESERVATION AND DIGITIZATION.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT&NBSP;NATIVE HAWAIIAN ELDERS, LOCAL RESIDENTS, AND&NBSP;RESEARCHERS&NBSP;OF NATIVE HAWAIIAN CULTURAL HERITAGE.&NBSP;&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

KONA HISTORICAL SOCIETY PHOTOGRAPH COLLECTION DIGITIZATION AND PUBLIC ACCESS PROJECT [THE KONA HISTORICAL SOCIETY (KHS) SEEKS TO HIRE A COLLECTIONS ASSISTANT TO SUPPORT THE WORK OF THE COLLECTIONS MANAGER; DOING THE WORK OF CATALOGING, DIGITIZING, HOUSING, AND STORING THE SOCIETY?S PHOTOGRAPH COLLECTION AND MAKING THE COLLECTION SAFELY ACCESSIBLE TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH ONLINE INITIATIVES. THE KHS PHOTO COLLECTION IS BACK LOGGED AND IN NEED OF PROCESSING AND DIGITIZING. HIRING A COLLECTIONS ASSISTANT TO FOCUS SPECIFICALLY ON THE PHOTO COLLECTION PORTION OF THE ARCHIVES WOULD ENABLE KHS TO MOVE FORWARD IN MAKING PHOTOGRAPHS ACCESSIBLE AND SEARCHABLE FOR THE PUBLIC AND RESEARCHERS OF KONA HISTORY.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT&NBSP;IS TO&NBSP;INCREASE CAPACITY FOR A LOCAL HISTORICAL SOCIETY IN&NBSP;KONA,&NBSP;HAWAII&NBSP;TO&NBSP;ARCHIVE AND PRESERVE&NBSP;A PHOTOGRAPH COLLECTION&NBSP;THAT&NBSP;DOCUMENTS&NBSP;HAWAIIAN HISTORY NOT CURRENTLY ACCESSIBLE TO THE PUBLIC.&NBSP;  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT FUNDS&NBSP;A NEW STAFF MEMBER TO HELP&NBSP;CATALOG, DIGITIZE, AND HOUSE THE SOCIETY?S PHOTOGRAPH COLLECTION AND MAKE&NBSP;THE COLLECTION SAFELY ACCESSIBLE TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH ONLINE INITIATIVES.&NBSP;&NBSP;  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THIS GRANT WOULD ALLOW THE COLLECTIONS STAFF TO PROCESS A BACKLOG OF PHOTOGRAPHIC ACCESSIONS&NBSP;WHICH WOULD ENABLE THE SOCIETY TO MOVE FORWARD IN MAKING PHOTOGRAPHS ACCESSIBLE AND SEARCHABLE FOR THE PUBLIC AND RESEARCHERS OF KONA HISTORY.&NBSP;  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT&NBSP;LOCAL KONA RESIDENTS WHO ENGAGE IN COMMUNITY RESEARCH AND WHO WILL BE THE PARTICIPANTS IN FUTURE PUBLIC EXHIBITIONS.&NBSP;  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

RESTARTING AN ORAL HISTORY PROGRAM ON THE JAPANESE AMERICAN WORLD WAR II INCARCERATION AND ITS AFTERMATH [DENSHO IS A PUBLIC HISTORY ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO THE JAPANESE AMERICAN WWII INCARCERATION; WE WORK TO INSPIRE ACTION FOR EQUITY AND AMPLIFY MARGINALIZED VOICES. AT THE CORE OF DENSHO'S ONLINE HOLDINGS ARE EDUCATIONAL, FREELY ACCESSIBLE VIDEO ORAL HISTORIES. AT A CRUCIAL TIME, WHEN REMAINING JAPANESE AMERICAN ELDERS WITH FIRSTHAND MEMORIES OF THE INCARCERATION AND ITS AFTERMATH ARE RAPIDLY DWINDLING, THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HALTED OUR ORAL HISTORY PROGRAM. WE AIM TO RESTART THIS PROGRAM WITH THE UNIQUE FOCUS ON JAPANESE AMERICANS WHO WERE INSPIRED BY THEIR WARTIME INCARCERATION TO PURSUE, "A MORE JUST, INCLUSIVE, AND SUSTAINABLE SOCIETY," FOR ALL AMERICANS. AS OUR COUNTRY CONFRONTS A RECKONING WITH ITS HISTORY OF ANTI-BLACKNESS AND THE RISE OF ANTI-ASIAN AMERICAN HATE, AWARENESS OF THESE STORIES AND LESSONS LEARNED PROMOTE EQUITY AND JUSTICE TODAY. NEH FUNDING WILL SUPPORT STAFFING TO CONDUCT THESE TIME-SENSITIVE INTERVIEWS AND TO PURCHASE EQUIPMENT ENSURING QUALITY AND PRESERVATION.] [PURPOSE:'THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO REESTABLISH THE ORAL HISTORY PROGRAM FOR A&NBSP;PUBLIC HISTORY ORGANIZATION&NBSP;IN SEATTLE, WASHINGTON. THE ORGANIZATION IS&NBSP;DEVOTED TO THE HISTORY OF JAPANESE AMERICAN&NBSP;INCARCERATION DURING WORLD WAR II.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT&NBSP;FUNDS STAFF AND EQUIPMENT TO CONDUCT, PROCESS, AND PRESERVE ORAL HISTORIES OF INDIVIDUALS IMPACTED BY JAPANESE AMERICAN INTERNMENT.&NBSP;  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:'THIS GRANT WOULD ALLOW THE&NBSP;PUBLIC HISTORY ORGANIZATION TO CONDUCT THESE TIME-SENSITIVE INTERVIEWS WITH THE HOPE THAT&NBSP;AWARENESS OF THESE STORIES WILL PROMOTE EQUITY AND JUSTICE TODAY.&NBSP;  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE&NBSP;JAPANESE AMERICAN COMMUNITY AS WELL AS THOSE WHO STUDY OR SEEK TO LEARN ABOUT THE UNITED&NBSP;STATES'&NBSP;RECKONING WITH ITS HISTORY OF ANTI-BLACKNESS AND THE RISE OF ANTI-ASIAN AMERICAN HATE.&NBSP;  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

GLBT HISTORICAL SOCIETY ARCHIVES: RESCUING OUR AMERICAN HISTORY [THE GLBT HISTORICAL SOCIETY SEEKS NEH FUNDING TO SUPPORT THREE ARCHIVES STAFF POSITIONS. THIS STAFF WILL WORK TO ACCESSION AND PROCESS THE BACKLOG OF ARCHIVAL DONATIONS THAT ACCUMULATED DURING COVID-19 SHELTER-IN-PLACE ORDERS, WHICH MADE ONSITE DONATIONS AND SUBSEQUENT ACCESSIONING AND PROCESSING IMPOSSIBLE. FURTHER, THEY WILL ENSURE THAT NEW MATERIAL IS MADE AVAILABLE TO BOTH ONSITE AND REMOTE RESEARCHERS. THIS PROJECT WILL ENSURE THAT LGBTQ HISTORICAL MATERIAL IS PROPERLY PRESERVED AND MADE ACCESSIBLE TO THE PUBLIC.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO&NBSP;SUPPORT ARCHIVAL STAFF AT AN LGBTQ HISTORICAL SOCIETY IN SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT FUNDS&NBSP;NEW AND EXISTING ARCHIVAL STAFF&NBSP;POSITIONS&NBSP;TO&NBSP;PROCESS A BACKLOG OF ARCHIVAL DONATIONS AND TO MAKE NEW ACQUISITIONS AND EXISTING COLLECTIONS OF LGBTQ HISTORY PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE THROUGH DIGITIZATION.&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THIS GRANT WOULD&NBSP;ALLOW THE HISTORICAL SOCIETY TO PROCESS A BACKLOG OF ARCHIVAL DONATIONS THAT ACCUMULATED DURING THE PANDEMIC, AND ENSURE THAT THESE NEW MATERIALS ARE&NBSP;PRESERVED&NBSP;AND&NBSP;MADE AVAILABLE TO ONSITE AND REMOTE RESEARCHERS.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE&NBSP;LOCAL AND NATIONAL PATRONS OF THE HISTORICAL SOCIETY AND RESEARCHERS OF LGBTQ HISTORY IN GENERAL.&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

RECLAIMING CULTURAL HERITAGE IN THE BORDERLANDS [RECLAIMING CULTURAL HERITAGE IN THE BORDERLANDS IS A ONE-YEAR PROJECT THAT BOLSTERS VITAL HUMANITIES RESEARCH, EDUCATION, AND PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT PROGRAMS ROOTED IN THE CULTURAL IDENTITY AND HISTORY OF THE BORDERLANDS REGION AS WELL AS IN UARIZONA?S DESIGNATION AS HISPANIC SERVING INSTITUTION (HSI). THIS PROJECT WILL 1) SUPPORT RESEARCH AND EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES VIA THE DIGITIZATION OF HUNDREDS OF UARIZONA PRESS BOOKS HIGHLIGHTING LATINX AND INDIGENOUS COMMUNITIES BUT CURRENTLY ONLY AVAILABLE IN PRINT, 2) CREATE AN ARCHIVE OF STORIES FOCUSED ON EFFORTS FOR RACIAL JUSTICE AND EQUALITY AMONG UNDERREPRESENTED BORDERLANDS COMMUNITIES, 3) PRESERVE UARIZONA?S CULTURAL AND HISTORIC SPACES LIKE THE NORVILLE GEM & MINERAL MUSEUM WHICH CONNECTS WITH THE HUMANITIES VIA PUBLIC PROGRAMMING ON THE HISTORY OF MINING IN ARIZONA AND MEXICAN COMMUNITIES, AND 4) REVAMP HUMANITIES SKILLS RESOURCES FOR UARIZONA?S UNDERREPRESENTED STUDENTS THROUGH WRITING WORKSHOPS AND MENTORSHIP PROGRAMS.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE&NBSP;UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA IN A CROSS-INSTITUTIONAL PROJECT&NBSP;THAT WILL HIGHLIGHT U.S.-MEXICO BORDERLANDS CULTURAL HERITAGE.&NBSP;&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT FUNDS MULTIPLE UNITS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA, INCLUDING&NBSP;UARIZONA&NBSP;PRESS, THE&NBSP;NORVILLE&NBSP;GEM AND MINERAL MUSEUM, THE WRITING SKILLS IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM, AND THE&NBSP;CONFLUENCENTER&NBSP;FOR CREATIVE INQUIRY. THESE VARIOUS GROUPS WILL DIGITIZE HUNDREDS OF LATINX AND INDIGENOUS BOOKS, CREATE AN&NBSP;ARCHIVE FOR BORDERLANDS COMMUNITIES,&NBSP;CREATE PUBLIC PROGRAMMING, AND HOST WRITING WORKSHOPS AND MENTORSHIP PROGRAMS FOR UNDERREPRESENTED STUDENTS.&NBSP;&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THIS GRANT WOULD INCREASE PUBLIC AND SCHOLARLY UNDERSTANDING OF U.S.-MEXICO BORDERLANDS CULTURAL HERITAGE AND PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR STUDENTS&NBSP;WITHIN THAT CULTURE.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT&NBSP;UNDERREPRESENTED STUDENTS AT THE UNIVERSITY, THE LOCAL BORDERLANDS COMMUNITY, AND ALLOW FOR BETTER&NBSP;PUBLIC ACCESS TO BORDERLANDS LITERATURE.&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

OURSTORY: MAKING HISTORY RELEVANT FOR NEW GENERATIONS [OURSTORY: MAKING HISTORY RELEVANT FOR NEW GENERATIONS IS A CROSS-ORGANIZATIONAL, CAPACITY-BUILDING PROJECT TO STRENGTHEN AND INTERPRET CINCINNATI MUSEUM CENTER (CMC) AND NATIONAL UNDERGROUND RAILROAD FREEDOM CENTER (NURFC)'S RICH HISTORY COLLECTIONS, WHICH TOGETHER NUMBER MORE THAN 1.42 MILLION ITEMS. THIS COLLABORATIVE PROJECT, WHICH COMES AT A CRITICAL MOMENT FOR BOTH ORGANIZATIONS, WILL SUPPORT COLLECTIONS MANAGEMENT AND EXHIBITION DEVELOPMENT. FUNDING WILL SUSTAIN THE ONGOING ACTIVITIES OF CURRENT CMC AND NURFC STAFF WHO PRESERVE, INTERPRET AND SHARE BOTH MUSEUMS' HISTORY COLLECTIONS. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE HIRING OF THREE NEW POSITIONS, CMC'S CURATOR OF HISTORICAL OBJECTS AND NURFC'S CURATOR AND MANAGER OF EXHIBIT DEVELOPMENT''WHO WILL PLAY CRITICAL ROLES IN THE PRESERVATION OF HISTORICAL COLLECTIONS AND DEVELOPMENT OF PERMANENT EXHIBITIONS THAT SHARE AND CONTEXTUALIZE HISTORY FOR THE PUBLIC.] [PURPOSE:'THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT THE CINCINNATI MUSEUM CENTER AS THEY IMPROVE THEIR COLLECTIONS MANAGEMENT AND EXHIBITION DEVELOPMENT CAPACITY ACROSS MULTIPLE INSTITUTIONS.&NBSP;  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT FUNDS&NBSP;CURATORIAL AND COLLECTIONS&NBSP;POSITIONS&NBSP;TO SUSTAIN THE ONGOING ACTIVITIES OF MUSEUM STAFF WHO INTERPRET MUSEUM COLLECTIONS AND CREATE PUBLIC AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING. IN ADDITION, STAFF WILL INCREASE THEIR EFFORTS IN PRESERVING&NBSP;HISTORICAL COLLECTIONS AND DEVELOPING PERMANENT EXHIBITIONS&NBSP;ON&NBSP;REGIONAL AND NATIONAL HISTORY.&NBSP;&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:'THIS GRANT&NBSP;WOULD SUSTAIN CURRENT MUSEUM INITIATIVES WHILE ALSO FUNDING THE STAFF TO PLAN FOR IMPORTANT HUMANITIES COLLABORATIONS IN THE FUTURE.&NBSP;  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT&NBSP;LOCAL AND NATIONAL MUSEUM VISITORS AS WELL AS REMOTE RESEARCHERS AND PATRONS TO THE CINCINNATI MUSEUM CENTER ONLINE.&NBSP;  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.]

CULTURAL LANDSCAPE REPORT FOR ANGEL MOUNDS STATE HISTORIC SITE [THE INDIANA STATE MUSEUM AND HISTORIC SITES WILL DEVELOP A CULTURAL LANDSCAPE REPORT (CLR) FOR ITS ANGEL MOUNDS STATE HISTORIC SITE, A MAJOR MISSISSIPPIAN CULTURAL CENTER AROUND 1000-1450 CE FOCUSED ON A PLANNED TOWN WITH MULTIPLE EARTHWORKS. THE CLR WILL BRING TOGETHER ESSENTIAL RESEARCH ABOUT THIS NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK AND GUIDE STEWARDSHIP OF THE PROPERTY, INCLUDING: ITS PRESERVATION; RESTORATION OF NATURAL LANDSCAPES; DEVELOPMENT OF LONG-TERM INTERPRETIVE AND VISITOR EXPERIENCE GOALS THAT FULLY INTEGRATE NATIVE PERSPECTIVES AND RECOMMENDATIONS; ARCHAEOLOGICAL MANAGEMENT; AND USE BY DESCENDANT NATIVE NATIONS. IT WILL ALSO BE THE FIRST STEP IN PLANNING A TOTAL REDESIGN OF THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE, TO BE COMPLETED BY 2026.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT&NBSP;A MUSEUM IN INDIANAPOLIS, INDIANA TO PREPARE A&NBSP;CULTURAL&NBSP;LANDSCAPE&NBSP;REPORT FOR A NATIVE AMERICAN MOUNDS HISTORIC SITE.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT FUNDS&NBSP;HISTORIC PRESERVATION STAFF WHO WILL PREPARE&NBSP;RESEARCH ABOUT THE ANGEL MOUNDS&NBSP;NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK AND GUIDE STEWARDSHIP OF THE PROPERTY, INCLUDING: ITS PRESERVATION; RESTORATION OF NATURAL LANDSCAPES;&NBSP;THE&NBSP;DEVELOPMENT OF LONG-TERM INTERPRETIVE AND VISITOR EXPERIENCE GOALS THAT FULLY INTEGRATE NATIVE PERSPECTIVES AND RECOMMENDATIONS; ARCHAEOLOGICAL MANAGEMENT; AND USE BY DESCENDANT NATIVE NATIONS.&NBSP;  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THIS GRANT WOULD&NBSP;FUND THE CREATION&NBSP;OF&NBSP;A CULTURAL LANDSCAPE REPORT WHICH WILL INFORM HOW THE PROPERTY WILL BE CARED FOR IN THE FUTURE AND WILL ALSO BE THE FIRST&NBSP;STEP IN PLANNING A TOTAL&NBSP;TRANSFORMATION&NBSP;OF THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE TO BE COMPLETED BY 2026.&NBSP;  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE ANGEL MOUNDS HISTORIC SITE, RESEARCHERS, THE PUBLIC, AND THE NATIVE PEOPLE DESCENDANT FROM THE ORIGINAL CREATORS OF THE SITE.&NBSP;  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

CITY OF DREAMS : THE ATLANTIC CITY EXPERIENCE [THE CITY OF DREAMS: THE ATLANTIC CITY EXPERIENCE PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE ATLANTIC CITY FREE PUBLIC LIBRARY (ACFPL) TO PRESERVE AND INCREASE ACCESS TO THE ATLANTIC CITY HERITAGE COLLECTIONS BY CREATING ?THE ATLANTIC CITY EXPERIENCE RESEARCH LIBRARY DIGITAL REPOSITORY.? THIS PROJECT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE COMMEMORATION OF THE 250TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE UNITED STATES BY DIGITIZING MATERIALS DOCUMENTING THE CONTRIBUTIONS OF THE AFRICAN AMERICAN COMMUNITY TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF ATLANTIC CITY AND TO THE NATION. WITH THE LARGEST COLLECTION OF PRINT, PHOTOGRAPHIC AND AUDIO-VISUAL MATERIALS ABOUT ATLANTIC CITY, THE ACFPL IS IN A UNIQUE POSITION TO TELL THIS STORY. FUNDING FOR THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE ACFPL TO FULFILL ITS HUMANITIES MISSION THROUGH THE RETENTION OF STAFF AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE DIGITAL INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDED TO INVITE THE EXPLORATION OF ATLANTIC CITY?S HISTORY WHILE FACING THE ENORMOUS CHALLENGE OF PROVIDING SERVICES DURING THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT&NBSP;A REGIONAL PUBLIC LIBRARY IN&NBSP;ATLANTIC&NBSP;CITY, NEW JERSEY, TO CREATE A NEW DIGITAL REPOSITORY FOR THEIR CULTURAL HERITAGE COLLECTIONS.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE&NBSP;PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT FUNDS&NBSP;NEW AND EXISTING LIBRARY STAFF AND THE PURCHASE OF DIGITIZATION EQUIPMENT UPGRADES FOR&NBSP;?THE ATLANTIC CITY EXPERIENCE RESEARCH LIBRARY DIGITAL REPOSITORY.? STAFF WILL IMPLEMENT NEW DIGITIZATION SOFTWARE AND WORK TO DIGITIZE AND DOCUMENT THEIR COLLECTIONS ONLINE.&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THIS GRANT WOULD&NBSP;INCREASE THE LIBRARY?S CAPACITY TO DIGITIZE AND PROVIDE ACCESS TO LOCAL CULTURAL HERITAGE MATERIALS. THIS NEW REPOSITORY WILL HOUSE DIGITIZED MATERIALS DOCUMENTING THE CONTRIBUTIONS OF THE AFRICAN AMERICAN COMMUNITY TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF&NBSP;ATLANTIC&NBSP;CITY AND TO THE NATION.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT&NBSP;WILL BENEFIT THE&NBSP;ATLANTIC&NBSP;CITY COMMUNITY BY INCREASING THEIR ACCESS TO LOCAL CULTURAL HERITAGE COLLECTIONS.&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

SURVEYING THE IMPACT OF COVID-19 ON CULTURAL COLLECTIONS IN WESTERN TENNESSEE [THIS PROJECT WILL SURVEY CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS IN TENNESSEE?S WEST GRAND DIVISION, INCLUDING AN ESTIMATED 150-200 AGENCIES ACROSS 21 COUNTIES LOCATED BETWEEN THE TENNESSEE AND MISSISSIPPI RIVERS TO CONFIRM EACH AGENCY?S CURRENT STATUS AND CREATE AN INSTITUTION-LEVEL SUMMARY OF RESEARCH COLLECTIONS, LEVELS OF EXISTING STAFFING AND BUDGET, HOURS OF OPERATION, AND PRESERVATION CONDITIONS FOR HERITAGE MATERIALS. A RESULTING ONLINE DIRECTORY OF CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS AND RESEARCH RESOURCES WILL BE CREATED AND MAINTAINED BY UT MARTIN. WHILE THE PROJECT IS PRIMARILY INTENDED TO CONFIRM, REVEAL AND PROMOTE THE AVAILABILITY OF RECORDS STORED IN ARCHIVES, MUSEUMS, CHURCHES, AND MUNICIPAL OFFICES, THE SURVEY WILL INCLUDE ARTIFACT COLLECTIONS, HISTORIC SITES, AND INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMS. A WORKSHOP ON BASIC PRESERVATION TECHNIQUES AND DISASTER PREPAREDNESS WILL BE REPEATED IN THREE LOCATIONS ACROSS THE REGION AND A CONCLUDING ONE-DAY CONFERENCE WILL BE SHARE RESULTS OF THE PROJECT.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO&NBSP;SUPPORT THE UNIVERSITY OF TENNESSEE, MARTIN&NBSP;IN THE&NBSP;CREATION OF&NBSP;A SURVEY OF CULTURAL HERITAGE INSTITUTIONS IN WEST TENNESSEE.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT FUNDS&NBSP;TEN&NBSP;STAFF&NBSP;POSITIONS&NBSP;WHO WILL WORK TOGETHER TO BEGIN A SURVEY OF CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS AND THEIR HOLDINGS IN THE WEST TENNESSEE REGION. STAFF WOULD SURVEY 150-200 ORGANIZATIONS ACROSS 21 COUNTIES TO CREATE A SUMMARY OF THEIR RESEARCH COLLECTIONS, ANALYZE THEIR BUDGET AND STAFFING, AND ASSESS THEIR PRESERVATION AND CONSERVATION NEEDS AND WOULD OFFER PRESERVATION AND DISASTER PREPAREDNESS WORKSHOPS FOR THESE SITES.&NBSP;  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THIS GRANT WOULD&NBSP;ALLOW THE UNIVERSITY TO BEGIN THIS CULTURAL HERITAGE ASSESSMENT AND EVENTUALLY COMPILE AND DISSEMINATE ITS ASSESSMENTS AND RECOMMENDATIONS IN A COMPREHENSIVE ONLINE DIRECTORY.&NBSP;  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT AIMS TO HELP CULTURAL HERITAGE INSTITUTIONS IN WEST TENNESSEE BY OFFERING EDUCATION AND TRAINING RESOURCES IN PRESERVATION AND ACCESS,&NBSP;HIGHLIGHTING THEIR COLLECTIONS,&NBSP;AND CONNECTING SCHOLARS AND THE PUBLIC TO THESE CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS.&NBSP;  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.]

WALKER ART CENTER COLLECTIONS: EXPANDING DIGITAL ACCESS AND ADVANCING DEMOGRAPHIC TRANSPARENCY [THE WALKER ART CENTER WILL HIRE A CURATORIAL FELLOW (COLLECTIONS), FOUR FULL-TIME CONTRACT POSITIONS, AND A SHORT-TERM CONTRACTOR AND PURCHASE THE NECESSARY EQUIPMENT TO: 1) DIGITIZE 6,070 UNDOCUMENTED OBJECTS IN THE WALKER'S SPECIAL COLLECTIONS; AND 2) RESEARCH AND COMPILE DEMOGRAPHIC DATA ON 2,400 ARTISTS IN THE COLLECTIONS. SPANNING THE EARLY 20TH CENTURY TO THE PRESENT DAY, THE SPECIAL COLLECTIONS REPRESENT MORE THAN HALF OF THE WALKER'S TOTAL HOLDINGS (14,000 WORKS). OBJECTS INCLUDE 8,872 WORKS ON PAPER (PRINTS, PHOTOGRAPHS, AND DRAWINGS) AND ARTIST BOOKS. LACK OF DOCUMENTATION HAS MADE THESE COLLECTIONS INACCESSIBLE TO CURATORS, SCHOLARS, AND THE PUBLIC DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. NEW DOCUMENTATION (IMAGES AND VIDEOS) AND ARTIST DEMOGRAPHIC DATA WILL INCREASE ACCESS VIA THE MUSEUM'S COLLECTION WEBSITE (WALKERART.ORG/COLLECTIONS), AND WILL SUPPORT A MULTITUDE OF HUMANITIES-BASED RESEARCH, PUBLICATION, EXHIBITION AND PUBLIC PROGRAMMING, AND INTERPRETATION EFFORTS.] [PURPOSE:'THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT&NBSP;IS TO&NBSP;INCREASE&NBSP;COLLECTIONS DIGITIZATION EFFORTS&NBSP;AND ENHANCE ARCHIVAL RESEARCH AT A CONTEMPORARY ART MUSEUM IN MINNEAPOLIS, MINNESOTA.&NBSP;&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THIS GRANT FUNDS FIVE COLLECTIONS AND DIGITIZATION POSITIONS AND ONE CURATORIAL POSITION AS WELL AS THE PURCHASE OF DIGITAL PHOTOGRAPHY EQUIPMENT.&NBSP;THIS STAFFING AND TECHNICAL IMPROVEMENTS WILL&NBSP;ALLOW THE MUSEUM TO DIGITIZE OVER 6,000 ARCHIVAL OBJECTS.&NBSP;IN ADDITION, THE STAFF WILL INCREASE THEIR ARCHIVAL DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT&NBSP;ENHANCED&NBSP;HUMANITIES-BASED RESEARCH&NBSP;AND PUBLIC PROGRAMMING.&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:'THIS GRANT WOULD ENSURE THAT THEIR COLLECTIONS ARE ACCESSIBLE TO CURATORS, SCHOLARS, AND THE PUBLIC DURING THE PANDEMIC AND IN THE FUTURE. IN ADDITION, INCREASED DOCUMENTATION WOULD ALLOW FOR&NBSP;MORE THOROUGH&NBSP;COLLECTIONS RESEARCH.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;SCHOLARS FROM ACROSS THE COUNTRY AS WELL AS THE LOCAL MUSEUM-GOING PUBLIC WOULD BENEFIT FROM THESE DIGITIZATION AND COLLECTIONS DOCUMENTATION EFFORTS.&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

RESTORING ACCESS TO THE BIOCULTURAL COLLECTION AT THE MISSOURI BOTANICAL GARDEN [THE BIOCULTURAL COLLECTION AT THE MISSOURI BOTANICAL GARDEN INCLUDES PLANT-BASED ARTS, CRAFTS, TOOLS, FOODS, MEDICINES, AND OTHER MATERIAL CULTURE ARTIFACTS. THE DISRUPTIONS CAUSED BY COVID-19 HAVE UNDERSCORED THE URGENCY OF PROTECTING THIS COLLECTION, AND SHOWN THE POTENTIAL FOR INCREASING ACCESS THROUGH ONLINE CATALOGING AND EVENTS. REQUESTED FUNDS WOULD BRIDGE CURRENT FINANCIAL UNPREDICTABILITY TO ENSURE THIS COLLECTION IS CURATED AND CATALOGUED, SHARED THROUGH ONLINE EVENT PROGRAMMING VIA THE GARDEN'S STEPHEN AND PETER SACHS MUSEUM, AND MADE WIDELY ACCESSIBLE THROUGH THE EXPANSION OF THE GARDEN'S PUBLICLY AVAILABLE TROPICOS BIODIVERSITY DATABASE TO INCLUDE ARTIFACTS. OUTCOMES WILL BE: RESTORED AND ENHANCED PRESERVATION OF AND ACCESS TO ~12,000 CULTURAL ARTIFACTS, THE CREATION AND RETENTION OF SPECIALIZED POSITIONS, THE RESUMPTION OF PUBLIC PROGRAMMING, AND THE CREATION OF A NOVEL FUNCTIONALITY TO INTEGRATE A PLANT-BASED CULTURAL COLLECTION WITHIN A BOTANICAL DATABASE.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT&NBSP;IS THE&NBSP;RETENTION OF TWO STAFF MEMBERS, THE HIRING OF?A?RESEARCH?SPECIALIST, AND?THE&NBSP;FUNDING OF?INTERNS, WHO WOULD ALL BE?ENGAGED&NBSP;IN A PROJECT&NBSP;TO?INCREASE ACCESS TO HISTORICAL?BIOCULTURAL?COLLECTIONS?AT?ONE OF THE?LARGEST?BOTANICAL GARDENS?IN NORTH AMERICA.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;A RESEARCHER AND A SENIOR STAFF MEMBER WOULD BE RETAINED, A RESEARCH SPECIALIST?WOULD BE?HIRED, AND FOUR INTERNS?WOULD BE EMPLOYED?TO ENGAGE IN CATALOG AND COLLECTION CURATION&NBSP;OF&NBSP;10,000 BIOCULTURAL ARTIFACTS AND ASSOCIATED ETHNOBOTANY DATA AND COLLECTIONS.&NBSP;TROPICOS, THE?APPLICANT?S?ONLINE BOTANICAL DATABASE, WILL BE IMPROVED TO&NBSP;BETTER INTEGRATE CULTURAL ARTIFACT INFORMATION AND CATALOG FUNCTIONALITY WHILE?IMPROVING USABILITY.?IN ADDITION, THE ORGANIZATION WOULD ALSO?HOST A VIRTUAL LECTURE SERIES ABOUT?BIOCULTURAL ARTIFACTS.?&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THE IMPROVEMENTS SHOULD&NBSP;RESTORE AND ENHANCE PRESERVATION OF AND ACCESS TO&NBSP;MORE THAN 10,000&NBSP;CULTURAL ARTIFACTS, THE CREATION AND RETENTION OF SPECIALIZED POSITIONS, THE RESUMPTION OF PUBLIC PROGRAMMING, AND THE CREATION OF A NOVEL FUNCTIONALITY TO INTEGRATE A PLANT-BASED CULTURAL COLLECTION WITHIN&NBSP;THE&NBSP;BOTANICAL DATABASE,&NBSP;TROPICOS.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;RESEARCHERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE&NBSP;CATALOGING OF THE BIOCULTURAL ARTIFACTS AND THE&NBSP;IMPROVEMENT OF THE&NBSP;TROPICOS&NBSP;DATABASE, ONE OF THE MOST OUTSTANDING RESEARCH RESOURCES OF ITS KIND, AVERAGING MORE THAN 178,000?USES?PER DAY AND,?WHICH SINCE 1982,?HAS BEEN AN ESSENTIAL TOOL TO BROADENING PUBLIC ACCESS TO THE GARDEN?S RESEARCH PROGRAMS AND?HISTORY OF?SCIENCE COLLECTIONS.&NBSP;THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM THE VIRTUAL LECTURE SERIES&NBSP;WHICH WILL BE&NBSP;AVAILABLE TO ALL ONLINE.&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

OGLALA LAKOTA COLLEGE LAKOTA LANGUAGE INTERVIEW CATALOGING AND DIGITIZATION [CATALOG AND DIGITIZE RECORDINGS OF LAKOTA ELDERS FROM THE PINE RIDGE AND CHEYENNE RIVER SIOUX RESERVATIONS] [PURPOSE:'THIS GRANT WILL RETAIN&NBSP;ONE'STAFF MEMBER AND'HIRE&NBSP;THREE CONSULTANTS TO CATALOG'AND DIGITIZE'421 RECORDINGS OF INTERVIEWS WITH LAKOTA ELDERS FROM FOUR RESERVATIONS.'&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THE APPLICANT'WOULD RETAIN'ITS'DIGITIZATION&NBSP;SPECIALIST&NBSP;AND&NBSP;WOULD'HIRE TWO CATALOGING'ASSISTANTS AND A LAKOTA LANGUAGE LINGUIST'WHO HAS WORKED WITH LAKOTA COMMUNITIES IN NORTH AND SOUTH DAKOTA FOR OVER 28 YEARS. THESE INDIVIDUALS WILL'PROCESS OVER 200 HOURS OF RECORDINGS OF INDIGENOUS, LAKOTA LANGUAGE&NBSP;SPEECH'THAT THE LINGUIST'HAS DONATED TO THE LIBRARY.&NBSP;&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:'THE'RECORDINGS&NBSP;AND THEIR CATALOG'WOULD'PROVIDE'A VALUABLE'CORPUS OF SPOKEN'NATIVE'LANGUAGE&NBSP;AND'WOULD'BE PRESERVED ON'THE'MUKURTU'CONTENT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM,'DESIGNED FOR INDIGENOUS COMMUNITIES TO MANAGE, SHARE, AND EXCHANGE THEIR DIGITAL HERITAGE IN CULTURALLY-RELEVANT'AND ETHICAL WAYS. THEY'WILL'BE HELD AT THE'WOKSAPE'TIPI LIBRARY, A FEDERAL DEPOSITORY LIBRARY, WHICH HAS EXTENSIVE ARCHIVAL COLLECTIONS.'&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:'A&NBSP;DIVERSE ARRAY OF HUMANITIES SCHOLARS, INCLUDING LINGUISTS, HISTORIANS, FOLKLORISTS, RELIGIOUS STUDIES SCHOLARS, ANTHROPOLOGISTS, AND SOCIOLOGISTS,&NBSP;WOULD BENEFIT FROM THIS COLLECTION OF RECORDINGS BEING ACCESSIBLE AND NAVIGABLE. STUDENTS IN THE LAKOTA STUDIES DEPARTMENT AT&NBSP;OGLALA DAKOTA COLLEGE&NBSP;AND STUDENTS OF THE LAKOTA LANGUAGE, HISTORY, AND CULTURE AT THE COLLEGE OR ELSEWHERE WOULD BENEFIT FROM THIS ARCHIVED COLLECTION OF INTERVIEWS WITH LAKOTA ELDERS.&NBSP;&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

SAILORS, AUTO WORKERS, AND ENTREPRENEURS: COLLECTING AND PRESERVING ARAB AMERICAN STORIES [FUNDS FROM THE AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN: HUMANITIES ORGANIZATIONS ARE REQUESTED TO RESTORE AANM'S CURATORIAL DEPARTMENT TO ITS PRE-PANDEMIC CAPACITY IN ORDER TO EMBARK ON A VITAL ORAL HISTORY COLLECTIONS INITIATIVE THAT WILL PROVIDE MORE BALANCE, DEPTH AND NUANCE TO THE NATIONAL ARAB AMERICAN STORY. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL POSITION AANM TO REHIRE A COMMUNITY HISTORY SPECIALIST AND WILL SUPPORT A PORTION OF THE CURATORIAL SPECIALIST'S SALARY WHILE WE RECORD, TRANSCRIBE, AND UPLOAD INTERVIEWS AND RELATED DONATED OBJECTS AND EPHEMERA INTO OUR COLLECTIONS IN ORDER TO KEEP PACE WITH THE COMMUNITIES WE AIM TO REPRESENT. THE RESULTS OF THIS WORK WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE ON AANM'S WEBSITE AND PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE ARCHIVE, AND PROMOTED THROUGH AANM'S VAST AND ESTABLISHED NETWORK OF CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS, SMITHSONIAN AFFILIATES, ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS, MUSEUMS, AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS ACROSS THE COUNTRY.] [PURPOSE:'THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS&NBSP;TO REHIRE&NBSP;A COMMUNITY HISTORY SPECIALIST, WHO'WILL&NBSP;WORK FULL-TIME ON THE ARAB AMERICAN NATIONAL MUSEUM'S (AANM) ORAL HISTORY COLLECTION PROJECT, AND TO'PARTIALLY&NBSP;FUND&NBSP;SIX OTHER'STAFF'POSITIONS, INCLUDING THE DIRECTOR,&NBSP;THE&NBSP;RESEARCH AND CONTENT MANAGER,&NBSP;A&NBSP;CURATORIAL SPECIALIST,&NBSP;THE&NBSP;CURATOR OF EXHIBITS,&NBSP;THE&NBSP;LIBRARIAN,'AND&NBSP;THE&NBSP;MULTIMEDIA SPECIALIST.''&NBSP;  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THE PROJECT WILL&NBSP;REINVIGORATE'THE'ARAB AMERICAN NATIONAL MUSEUM'S ORAL HISTORY COLLECTION WORK, WHICH'PAUSED'DURING THE PANDEMIC AS THE ORGANIZATION LET GO OF ITS CORE PROJECT TEAM AND PIVOTED TO'FOCUS ON'DIGITAL'PROGRAMMING.'DURING THE'PROJECT, THE APPLICANT'WILL&NBSP;PRODUCE AND MAKE ACCESSIBLE'30'VIDEO&NBSP;INTERVIEWS'WITH'YEMENI'SEAFARERS,'WOMEN'IN THE AUTOMOTIVE INDUSTRY, AND'ENTREPRENEURS,&NBSP;AS WELL AS COLLECT ASSOCIATED PHYSICAL MATERIALS,'PHOTOS,'AND DOCUMENTS'THAT'THE MUSEUM'WILL'DIGITIZE AND/OR ACCESSION ACCORDINGLY.'&NBSP;  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:'THE&NBSP;EXPANDED ORAL HISTORY COLLECTIONS&NBSP;WILL BE USED FOR&NBSP;NEW EXHIBITS, PROGRAMS, AND EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH, AS WELL AS BEING OF INTEREST TO RESEARCHERS.'&NBSP;THE PROPOSED ACTIVITY--ORAL HISTORY COLLECTION--AND TARGETED COMMUNITIES FOR THESE ORAL HISTORIES,&NBSP;WILL&NBSP;STRATEGICALLY DIVERSIFY THE&NBSP;MUSEUM'S&NBSP;COLLECTIONS&NBSP;BY ENCOMPASSING A&NBSP;BROADER RANGE OF ARAB-AMERICAN&NBSP;EXPERIENCE&NBSP;AND HISTORY.'&NBSP;&NBSP;  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;VISITORS TO THE PHYSICAL MUSEUM AND ONLINE&NBSP;VISITORS&NBSP;WILL BENEFIT FROM THE ORAL HISTORY COLLECTIONS WHICH WILL BE USED FOR NEW PROGRAMS AND OUTREACH. SCHOLARS AND RESEARCHERS COULD BENEFIT FROM THE ORAL HISTORY COLLECTIONS.&NBSP;  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

PEOPLE OF THE SEA AND CEDAR GALLERY, PHASE TWO: ADDITIONS AND UPGRADES TO AN EXHIBIT OF INDIGENOUS CULTURE, ART, AND HISTORY ['PEOPLE OF THE SEA AND CEDAR: A JOURNEY THROUGH THE HISTORY AND CULTURE OF THE TRIBES OF THE NORTHWEST COAST" IS A PERMANENT GALLERY AT THE WHATCOM MUSEUM, DESIGNED TO EVOLVE WITH CHANGING CULTURAL STORIES AND PROVIDE A SPACE FOR ROTATION OF ARTWORK, ARTIFACTS, NARRATIVES, AND INITIATIVES. NOW, FOUR YEARS AFTER ITS INITIAL CREATION, THE GALLERY IS READY FOR PHASE TWO. CONSULTING DIRECTLY WITH LOCAL INDIGENOUS TRIBES, THE PROJECT WILL INCORPORATE NEW STORIES OF SUSTAINABILITY, PROVIDE FOR NEW NARRATIVE PANELS THAT FEATURE NATIVE VOICES, UPGRADE TECHNOLOGY, AND ALLOW FOR THE PRESERVATION, DISPLAY, AND INTERPRETATION OF TWO 50-YEAR-OLD NATIVE-CARVED TOTEM POLES. THESE OBJECTIVES, WHICH HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED THROUGH NEW AND CLOSER RELATIONSHIPS WITH LOCAL TRIBES, ARE IMPORTANT TO ENSURING THAT THE GALLERY REFLECTS THE TRIBES AS THEY WANT TO BE REPRESENTED AND PROVIDES ADDITIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE REST OF OUR COMMUNITY TO LEARN AND BECOME EDUCATED ABOUT NATIVE CULTURE, HISTORY, AND ART.] [PURPOSE:'THE PURPOSE&NBSP;IS TO&NBSP;RETAIN THREE STAFF POSITIONS AND CONSULTANTS'TO DEEPEN SCHOLARSHIP AND ENHANCE A CORE EXHIBIT ABOUT COASTAL NATIVE PEOPLE, AS WELL AS'TO PRODUCE&NBSP;AN'EDUCATIONAL'VIDEO'AND'TO ESTABLISH AN&NBSP;APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAM RELATED TO HISTORIC TOTEM'POLES&NBSP;AT THE&NBSP;WHATCOM MUSEUM.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE&NBSP;DIRECTOR OF&NBSP;EXHIBITIONS, THE&NBSP;AUDIO-VISUAL&NBSP;TECHNICIAN, A'COLLECTIONS&NBSP;CURATOR, AND'CONSULTANTS&NBSP;WILL&NBSP;ENHANCE THE PERMANENT EXHIBIT&NBSP;"PEOPLE OF THE SEA AND CEDAR: A JOURNEY THROUGH THE TRIBAL CULTURES AND HISTORY OF THE NORTHWEST COAST"&NBSP;IN VARIOUS WAYS.&NBSP;THEY WILL&NBSP;EXPAND&NBSP;EXHIBITION&NBSP;NARRATIVES AND TEXT PANELS&NBSP;THROUGH RESEARCH AND&NBSP;IN CONSULTATION WITH INDIGENOUS EXPERTS, UPDATE EXHIBIT&NBSP;TECHNOLOGY, AND INSTALL NEW OBJECTS SUCH AS TWO NATIVE-CARVED TOTEM POLES RESTORED WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF GRANT-FUNDED APPRENTICES FROM THE LUMMI AND NOOKSACK NATIONS.'&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:''THIS IMPROVEMENT OF A&NBSP;PERMANENT&NBSP;EXHIBITION ABOUT&NBSP;INDIGENOUS AND NATIVE TRIBAL HISTORY&NBSP;IN THE REGION,&NBSP;WHICH IS&NBSP;CORE TO THE MUSEUM'S MISSION, WOULD&NBSP;SERVE&NBSP;WIDE AUDIENCES OF PEOPLE WHO VISIT THE MUSEUM AND WHO ENGAGE IN EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS THERE.&NBSP;&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THOUSANDS OF SCHOOL CHILDREN, TEACHERS,'AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS&NBSP;WHO VISIT THE MUSEUM WILL BENEFIT FROM THE IMPROVED CORE EXHIBITION.&NBSP;&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

SCHOOL SAGAS: DESEGREGATION THEN AND NOW [THE BISHOP BLUE FOUNDATION IS REQUESTING A $20,000 GRANT TO DEVELOP A PLAN FOR PRESENTING FILMED SCHOOL SAGAS ORAL HISTORIES (COLLECTED FROM ALUMNI AND CURRENT STUDENTS OF FORMERLY SEGREGATED SCHOOLS IN THE ARK-LA-TEX REGION WHERE ARKANSAS, LOUISIANA, AND TEXAS MEET) TO AN ONLINE AUDIENCE OF SCHOLARS, GRADE SCHOOL STUDENTS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC INTERESTED IN ENGAGING WITH CHALLENGING TOPICS LIKE RACE, SEGREGATION, INTEGRATION, AND EQUITY IN A PUBLIC SCHOOL SYSTEM WHERE CONSTITUTIONAL PROTECTIONS FOR QUALITY EDUCATION CONTINUE TO BE DEBATED. WE ARE REQUESTING FUNDING UNDER THE ?A MORE PERFECT UNION? INITIATIVE AS OUR PROJECT DEMONSTRATES THE LIMITATIONS OF SUPREME COURT DECISIONS RELIANT UPON LOCAL IMPLEMENTATION.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO&NBSP;RETAIN A?FILM EDITOR,&NBSP;AN&NBSP;ONLINE COLLECTIONS CONSULTANT, AND A SENIOR STAFF MEMBER,?AS WELL AS TWO SCHOLARS,?TO PRODUCE AN?ONLINE DATABASE OF ORAL HISTORY AND EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS ABOUT SCHOOL DESEGREGATION,?IN CONJUNCTION WITH?THE 50TH ANNIVERSARY OF COURT-MANDATED PUBLIC-SCHOOL DESEGREGATION IN CADDO PARISH, LOUISIANA.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHERS WILL&NBSP;PRODUCE&NBSP;A WEBSITE CONTAINING 25 INTERVIEWS,?ARCHIVAL DOCUMENTS, AND A COMPANION CURRICULUM,?FOCUSING ON TWO RACIALLY SEGREGATED HIGH SCHOOLS IN CADDO PARISH IN LOUISIANA?S NORTHWEST CORNER THAT CONTINUED UNTIL?A 1969?SUPREME COURT DECISION?FORCED?AN END TO THE?PRACTICE&NBSP;OF SCHOOL SEGREGATION&NBSP;THERE.?&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THE&NBSP;WEBSITE&NBSP;WOULD DEEPEN UNDERSTANDING OF STUDENT EXPERIENCES?ALONG?THE PATH TO&NBSP;DESEGREGATION THROUGH FIRST-HAND ACCOUNTS OF THE LESSER-KNOWN STORY OF THE?LONGSTANDING?SEGREGATED SCHOOL SYSTEM IN LOUISIANA?S CADDO PARRISH.?&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;SCHOLARS, STUDENTS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC INTERESTED IN ENGAGING WITH TOPICS LIKE RACE, DESEGREGATION, AND EQUITY IN SCHOOLS&NBSP;WOULD BENEFIT FROM THIS RESOURCE.&NBSP;&NBSP;&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

PRESERVING THE PAST, SUPPORTING THE STAFF: PRESERVATION AND ACCESS AT THE CENTER FOR JEWISH HISTORY [AT THE CENTER FOR JEWISH HISTORY, AN NEH ARP GRANT WILL FUND PRESERVATION ACTIVITIES ADVERSELY AFFECTED BY THE PANDEMIC, EXPAND ACCESS TO COLLECTIONS IN RESPONSE TO THE CURRENT MOMENT, AND HELP SECURE 15 HUMANITIES JOBS. THE CENTER IS THE COLLABORATIVE HOME OF FIVE IN-HOUSE PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE HOLDINGS FORM THE LARGEST COLLECTION FOR JEWISH HISTORY AND CULTURE IN THE WORLD OUTSIDE ISRAEL. PARTNERS RELY ON CENTER STAFF FOR THE READING ROOM, ONLINE CATALOG, AND ARCHIVAL PRESERVATION SERVICES. WITH NEH ARP FUNDING, CENTER STAFF WILL ADDRESS PRESERVATION NEEDS LARGELY PUT ON HOLD DURING THE PANDEMIC: PRESERVING PHYSICAL COLLECTIONS, REINVIGORATING THE DIGITAL PRESERVATION PROGRAM, AND PRESERVING AT-RISK AUDIOVISUAL ITEMS. THE CENTER WILL ALSO INCREASE ACCESS TO COLLECTIONS IN RESPONSE TO THE MOMENT BY PREPARING AN EXHIBIT ON JEWISH EMANCIPATION, DIGITIZING MATERIALS ON BLACK-JEWISH RACE RELATIONS THAT HAVE SEEN RECENT RESEARCH INTEREST, AND PROVIDING DIGITIZATION ON DEMAND.] [PURPOSE:'THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO&NBSP;RETAIN&NBSP;14&NBSP;CORE STAFF JOBS AND&NBSP;HIRE&NBSP;AN INTERN&NBSP;TO&NBSP;SUSTAIN&NBSP;PUBLIC-FACING AND PRESERVATION-ORIENTED&NBSP;SERVICES OF THE CENTER FOR JEWISH HISTORY (CJH). CJH IS&NBSP;THE&NBSP;COLLABORATIVE HOME OF FIVE IN-HOUSE PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE COLLECTIONS EVIDENCE THE MULTI-DIMENSIONAL HISTORY OF JEWISH PEOPLE FROM AROUND THE WORLD.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THESE STAFF MEMBERS WILL&NBSP;ENGAGE IN PRESERVING PHYSICAL COLLECTIONS,'WILL&NBSP;INCREASE&NBSP;ACCESS TO COLLECTIONS BY CONTINUING TO&NBSP;PROVIDE&NBSP;DIGITIZATION ON DEMAND,'AND&NBSP;WILL&NBSP;PREPARE&NBSP;AN ONSITE EXHIBIT'AMONG OTHER ACTIVITIES'AT THE NATION'S LARGEST REPOSITORY OF ARCHIVAL MATERIALS ON JEWISH AMERICAN HISTORY AND CULTURE.&NBSP;OTHER ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE CONTINUATION OF THE&NBSP;BORN-DIGITAL TASKFORCE WITH PARTNERS, EXPANDING BORN-DIGITAL WORKFLOW DOCUMENTATION, AND REVISITING AND REVAMPING AN OUT-OF-DATE DIGITAL PRESERVATION POLICY DRAFT.&NBSP;  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:'THE&NBSP;GRANT WILL ALLOW FOR THE&NBSP;PRESERVATION,'PROCESSING,'AND DIGITIZING OF&NBSP;A WIDE RANGE OF COLLECTIONS,'INCLUDING'AT-RISK&NBSP;AUDIO-VISUAL'MATERIALS. THE CONTINUED FUNCTIONING OF THE CENTER FOR JEWISH HISTORY WILL RESULT FROM THIS GRANT, SPECIFICALLY THE&NBSP;READING ROOM, THE ONLINE PUBLIC ACCESS CATALOG (SEARCH.CJH.ORG), AND THE NETWORK OF SYSTEMS USED TO MANAGE ALL FIVE PARTNERS' LIBRARY, ARCHIVE, AND MUSEUM HOLDINGS&NBSP;WILL REMAIN AVAILABLE.&NBSP;THE INTERN POSITION&NBSP;WILL REVIVE&NBSP;A PREVIOUS, SUCCESSFUL CONSERVATION INTERNSHIP PROGRAM&NBSP;AND&NBSP;WILL&NBSP;CREATE A MORE SUSTAINABLE STAFFING MODEL FOR THE PRESERVATION SERVICES LAB.&NBSP;  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;RESEARCHERS, SCHOLARS, EDUCATORS,&NBSP;AND THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM THE CONTINUED OPERATIONS&NBSP;AS WILL&NBSP;THE FIVE IN-HOUSE PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS SERVED BY THE CENTER FOR JEWISH HISTORY.&NBSP;IN 2019, THE CENTER WELCOMED OVER 46,000 VISITORS ONSITE (67% ADULTS, 22% SENIORS, 6% STUDENTS, 5% CHILDREN).&NBSP;&NBSP;  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

EXPLORING AMERICA'S STORIES IN THE CLEMSON LANDSCAPE: AN NEH AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN [CLEMSON UNIVERSITY, IN FORMERLY CHEROKEE TERRITORY, INCLUDES SEVERAL FORMER PLANTATIONS (INCLUDING JOHN C. CALHOUN'S FORT HILL) ON WHICH ENSLAVED AFRICAN AMERICANS WERE FORCED TO RESIDE AND WORK, BUILDINGS BUILT BY AFRICAN AMERICAN CONVICT LABORERS, AND CCC WORK SITES. CLEMSON'S 17,000 ACRES TELL A NATIONAL, HEMISPHERIC AND TRANSATLANTIC STORY WITH LOCAL MATERIALS. SOME OF THIS HISTORY IS BURIED, AND IN NEED OF COORDINATED HISTORICAL AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL RECOVERY, DOCUMENTATION, INTERPRETATION, PRESERVATION, PROTECTION, AND, WHEN APPROPRIATE, DISSEMINATION. IN SUMMER 2020, FOR EXAMPLE, WE DISCOVERED OVER 600 UNMARKED GRAVES IN THE ON-CAMPUS CEMETERY. BUT COVID BUDGET CUTS THREATEN, AND A HIRING FREEZE DEFERRED, POST-DOCS. WE APPLY FOR NEH AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN FUNDS TO PROTECT A CURRENT POST-DOC (THREATENED) AND INVEST IN ARCHAEOLOGICAL MATERIALS (E.G., A GEOLOCATOR) AND TWO 1-YEAR ARCHAEOLOGY POST-DOCS (DEFERRED) TO DOCUMENT AND EXPLORE AMERICA'S STORIES IN THE CLEMSON LANDSCAPE.] [PURPOSE:'THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO&NBSP;RETAIN'ONE'POST&NBSP;DOCTORAL'RESEARCHER'AND'HIRE'TWO'OTHERS,'ALONG WITH&NBSP;PROVIDING'PARTIAL'FUNDING FOR'THREE FACULTY MEMBERS&NBSP;TO'EXPAND'AND&NBSP;COORDINATE INTERDISCIPLINARY RESEARCH&NBSP;PRIMARILY&NBSP;ON ENSLAVED AFRICAN AMERICANS AT CLEMSON UNIVERSITY&NBSP;(CU)&NBSP;AND TO RESTART'ARCHAEOLOGICAL FIELD SCHOOL'OPERATING ON CLEMSON'S CAMPUS&NBSP;FOCUSING ON THIS RESEARCH PROJECT.&NBSP; &NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE&NBSP;GRANT WILL ALLOW THE REOPENING OF&NBSP;CU'S'ARCHAEOLOGICAL FIELD SCHOOL. THE&NBSP;TWO POSTDOCTORAL RESEARCHERS'(ONE IN ARCHEOLOGY AND THE OTHER IN HISTORIC HOUSES)&NBSP;WILL&NBSP;ENGAGE IN HISTORICAL AND ARCHEOLOGICAL RECOVERY, DOCUMENT THEIR FINDINGS, ENGAGE IN THE PRESERVATION OF ARTIFACTS,&NBSP;PRODUCE&NBSP;A PLAN FOR INTERPRETATION FOR THE HISTORIC SITES ON CLEMSON'S CAMPUS BASED ON THEIR ARCHEOLOGICAL FINDINGS, AND DISSEMINATE THE RESULTS OF THEIR WORK.&NBSP;'ANOTHER'POSTDOCTORAL FELLOW WILL'CONTINUE RESEARCH'FOR THE''CALL MY NAME''PROJECT,'A&NBSP;MULTIDIMENSIONAL&NBSP;PROJECT&NBSP;DOCUMENTING THE&NBSP;BLACK EXPERIENCE IN'SOUTH CAROLINA'FROM ENSLAVEMENT TO DESEGREGATION. OTHER ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THIS GRANT INCLUDE&NBSP;HISTORICAL AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL RECOVERY, DOCUMENTATION, INTERPRETATION,'AND THE&NBSP;PRESERVATION&NBSP;OF ARTIFACTS.&NBSP;  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:'A&NBSP;CAMPUS CONSERVATION AND STEWARDSHIP PLAN, WITH THE GOAL OF AVOIDING FURTHER DEGRADATION OF CULTURAL SITES, WILL BE DEVELOPED. ALSO, A&NBSP;PLAN FOR HOW TO INCORPORATE THE MYRIAD OF HISTORICAL POPULATIONS THAT LIVED ON AND BUILT THE CLEMSON LANDSCAPE INTO&NBSP;THE&NBSP;CAMPUS INTERPRETIVE NARRATIVE&NBSP;WILL BE WRITTEN.&NBSP;PUBLIC-FACING UPDATES WILL BE PRESENTED ON THE PROJECT'S&NBSP;WEBSITE AND SOCIAL MEDIA PRESENCE.&NBSP;THE&NBSP;SIMULTANEOUS&NBSP;RESEARCH PROJECTS&NBSP;SHOULD EXPAND&NBSP;THE&NBSP;SCHOLARLY AND&NBSP;PUBLIC UNDERSTANDING OF THE&NBSP;BLACK EXPERIENCE AT CLEMSON UNIVERSITY AND IN SOUTH CAROLINA, MORE BROADLY, FROM ENSLAVEMENT TO DESEGREGATION.&NBSP;&NBSP;  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;CLEMSON STUDENTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS ALIKE&NBSP;WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT AS WILL THE VISITORS TO THE&NBSP;CALHOUN FORT HILL SITE,&NBSP;A NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK,&NBSP;VISITED BY 15,000 PEOPLE ANNUALLY&NBSP;AND, ALSO, THE GENERAL PUBLIC WHO CAN&NBSP;VIEW&NBSP;THE PROJECT'S WEBSITE.&NBSP;&NBSP;  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

DIGITAL ACCESS AND PRESERVATION: CALLING ATTENTION TO DIVERSE VOICES IN APPALACHIA [EAST TENNESSEE STATE UNIVERSITY'S REECE MUSEUM AND ARCHIVES OF APPALACHIA WILL PROVIDE FREE ONLINE ACCESS TO OVER 30,000 RARE OR UNIQUE ITEMS THAT HAVE PREVIOUSLY ONLY BEEN ACCESSIBLE THROUGH IN-PERSON VISITS TO ETSU. THESE ITEMS INCLUDE ARTIFACTS, PHOTOGRAPHS, AUDIO RECORDINGS, AND MANUSCRIPT MATERIALS THAT COLLECTIVELY DEMONSTRATE THE DIVERSITY OF THE PEOPLE AND THE CULTURES OF SOUTHERN APPALACHIA. THEY PROVIDE A TANGIBLE LINK TO THE DIVERSE LIVED EXPERIENCES OF THE PEOPLE OF THIS REGION, DRAWING NEW ATTENTION TO AFRICAN-AMERICAN APPALACHIANS AND FEMALE APPALACHIANS AND CALLING INTO QUESTION THE REDUCTIVE STEREOTYPES THAT HAVE OFTEN CIRCUMSCRIBED PUBLIC PERCEPTIONS OF THE REGION.] [PURPOSE:'THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO&NBSP;HIRE&NBSP;THREE STAFF MEMBERS,'ALONG WITH&NBSP;PROVIDE&NBSP;FUNDING FOR'CURRENT'STAFF&NBSP;AND TO HIRE&NBSP;UNDERGRADUATE'STUDENTS, AND'PURCHASE&NBSP;RELATED SUPPLIES NEEDED TO PROVIDE FREE ONLINE ACCESS TO ARTIFACTS AND COLLECTIONS AT THE ARCHIVES OF APPALACHIA AND THE REECE MUSEUM'DOCUMENTING'THE DIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN APPALACHIA.'&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;THE ARCHIVES OF APPALACHIA (AA) AND THE REECE MUSEUM (RM) ARE UNITS WITHIN EAST TENNESSEE STATE UNIVERSITY'S CENTER FOR APPALACHIAN STUDIES.'THEIR COLLECTIONS HAVE BEEN WIDELY USED IN PERSON BY THE PUBLIC, SCHOLARS, AND FILMMAKERS. RESPONDING TO THE TRAVEL LIMITATIONS&NBSP;AND TO STAFF REDUCTIONS&NBSP;CAUSED BY THE PANDEMIC,'RM WILL&NBSP;HIRE A'DIGITAL'ENGAGEMENT'COORDINATOR'AND A PART-TIME PHOTOGRAPHER'TO PROCESS ARTIFACTS, PROVIDE METADATA STANDARDIZATION, AND LAUNCH A COLLECTIONS PORTAL PROVIDING ACCESS TO OVER 22,000 IMAGES,'WHILE A&NBSP;PROJECT&NBSP;ARCHIVIST AT AA, WITH ASSISTANCE FROM UNDERGRADUATES, WILL&NBSP;PROCESS&NBSP;13&NBSP;COLLECTIONS'CONTAINING'ORAL HISTORY INTERVIEWS, PHOTOGRAPHS, AND OTHER MANUSCRIPT MATERIALS'PERTAINING TO'AFRICAN AMERICANS AND FEMALE COAL MINERS'IN THE REGION.'&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:'THE&NBSP;PROJECT&NBSP;SHOULD&NBSP;ENHANCE ACCESS'TO'SIGNIFICANT, NEWLY PRIORITIZED'COLLECTIONS'AT A LOCATION VISITED BY OVER 2,000 RESEARCHERS A YEAR&NBSP;WHICH WILL NOW BE AVAILABLE ONLINE FOR RESEARCH FOR SCHOLARS, THE PUBLIC AND OTHERS INTERESTED IN LEARNING FROM THIS&NBSP;PROMINENT&NBSP;COLLECTION OF OVER 20,000 ARTIFACTS&NBSP;RELATED TO THE PEOPLE AND HISTORY OF SOUTHERN APPALACHIA.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;RESEARCHERS, SCHOLARS, THE PUBLIC AND OTHERS INTERESTED IN LEARNING FROM THIS COLLECTION WILL BENEFIT FROM HAVING ONLINE ACCESS.&NBSP;&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

MULTIPLICITY: ABSTRACTION, PATTERN & IDENTITY IN LIMITED-EDITION ART? INTEGRATING FINE ART MULTIPLES INTO PCG?S PERMANENT COLLECTION [PROVIDENCE COLLEGE GALLERIES [PCG] WILL INTEGRATE RECENT ART ACQUISITIONS INTO ITS PERMANENT COLLECTION VIA PHYSICAL DISPLAYS IN PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE SPACES, AN ONLINE CATALOG, AND THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PROPER STORAGE AND PRESERVATION METHODS. THE 75 NEWLY ACQUIRED ARTWORKS SHOWCASE AMERICAN CONTEMPORARY ARTISTS? EXPLORATIONS OF PERSONAL AND COLLECTIVE IDENTITY, HERITAGE, AND CROSS-CULTURAL NARRATIVES. THEY ARE ALL LIMITED-EDITION ARTWORKS, INCLUDING FINE ART PRINTS, SMALL SCULPTURE, ARTIST BOOKS AND MORE. AS PART OF THE INTEGRATION PROCESS, A PROJECT TEAM WILL FIRST DIGITIZE, INTERPRET, AND PRESERVE THE ARTWORKS AND THEN ORGANIZE THEM INTO PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE PHYSICAL DISPLAYS COMPRISED OF THEMATICALLY CURATED SECTIONS. TO FURTHER EXPAND PUBLIC ACCESS TO THESE RECENT ACQUISITIONS, AS WELL OTHER ASPECTS OF PCG?S PERMANENT COLLECTION, THE ARTWORKS WILL BE ACCESSIBLE VIA THE WEBSITE IN AN ONLINE CATALOG AND COLLECTION DATABASE AND BY APPOINTMENT IN A NEW FINE ART PRINT STUDY HUB.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS&NBSP;THE&NBSP;HIRING OF THREE PART-TIME STAFF MEMBERS AND VARIOUS CONTRACTORS TO INTEGRATE?75?RECENT?CONTEMPORARY?ART ACQUISITIONS INTO THE PERMANENT COLLECTION&NBSP;AND&NBSP;TO&NBSP;MOUNT SEMI-PERMANENT?THEMATIC?EXHIBITS?IN THE GALLERIES, AT THE PHILIPS MEMORIAL LIBRARY, AND AT THE RUANE CENTER FOR THE HUMANITIES,?AND?TO?PRODUCE AN ONLINE CATALOG?RELATED TO THE?PROJECT?S CENTRAL CONCEPT,&NBSP;"MULTIPLICITY: ABSTRACTION, PATTERN & IDENTITY IN LIMITED- EDITION ART? AT&NBSP;PROVIDENCE COLLEGE GALLERIES (PCG).&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;AN&NBSP;ACADEMIC&NBSP;CURATOR,?A?REGISTRAR, AND A&NBSP;COLLECTION&NBSP;FELLOW WOULD BE HIRED ALONG WITH THE FOLLOWING CONTRACTORS:&NBSP;A GRAPHIC DESIGNER, FABRICATOR, WEB DEVELOPER, ART HANDLER, AND?EDITOR,&NBSP;TO PROCESS AND DEVELOP EXHIBITIONS AROUND&NBSP;75 CONTEMPORARY LIMITED-EDITION FINE-ART ACQUISITIONS?BY DIVERSE ARTISTS,?INCLUDING?PRINTS, SMALL SCULPTURE, AND ARTIST BOOKS. THE ACQUISITIONS&NBSP;WOULD BE STORED, PRESERVED, DIGITIZED, INTERPRETED, AND EXHIBITED IN THE MAIN GALLERY?AT?PCG?AND OTHER SITES ON CAMPUS?FOR FIVE YEARS AND ONLINE.&NBSP;AN&NBSP;ONLINE CATALOG THAT CONSOLIDATES IMAGES OF THE "MULTIPLICITY" EXHIBIT, INDIVIDUAL ARTWORKS, AND INTERPRETIVE TEXTS&NBSP;WILL BE PUBLISHED.&NBSP;EXHIBITS?WOULD?EXAMINE HOW THESE ARTISTS USE COLOR, REPETITION, AND DECORATION TO COMMENT ON SUBJECTS LIKE RACE, RELIGION, GENDER, AND SEXUAL ORIENTATION.?&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THE&NBSP;EXHIBITIONS AND OTHER ACTIVITIES SHOULD PROVIDE THE PUBLIC WITH SEVERAL DIFFERENT PORTALS TO ACCESS THE ARTWORKS&NBSP;AND TO ACCESS INTERPRETATIONS OF THEM.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;AUDIENCES FOR THESE EXHIBITIONS INCLUDE STUDENTS AT PROVIDENCE COLLEGE AND&NBSP;OTHER&NBSP;REGIONAL&NBSP;AND BROAD&NBSP;AUDIENCES WHO VISIT THE GALLERIES. PRESERVATION OF CORE HUMANITIES PROGRAMS AND ASSETS AT SOUTH STREET SEAPORT MUSEUM [IN MITIGATING THE IMPACTS OF COVID-19, THE SOUTH STREET SEAPORT MUSEUM IS ENSURING THE PRESERVATION OF ITS COLLECTIONS AND LANDMARKED SHIPS AND BUILDINGS WHILE INCREASING ACCESS TO THESE ASSETS HELD IN THE PUBLIC TRUST AND THE HUMANITIES INITIATIVES THEY SUPPORT. IN 2021, THE MUSEUM WILL FOCUS ON SUSTAINING CORE HUMANITIES PROGRAMMING FOR ADULTS AND STUDENTS WHILE TRANSITIONING BACK TO IN-PERSON PROGRAMMING AND CONTINUING VIRTUAL PROGRAMMING BASED ON DATA AND LESSONS LEARNED IN 2020. NEH FUNDS WILL PROVIDE RELIEF TO FUND KEY STAFF POSITIONS THAT SUPPORT THE PRESERVATION OF AND ACCESS TO THE MUSEUM'S COLLECTIONS, INCLUDING THE EXPANSION OF THE NEW COLLECTIONS ONLINE PORTAL, AS WELL AS SCHOOL-AGE EDUCATION PROGRAMS, LETTERPRESS PRINTING WORKSHOPS, EXHIBITION CONTENT, AND PUBLIC PROGRAMS, ALL OF WHICH ENGAGE PARTICIPANTS TO MAKE CONNECTIONS BETWEEN THEIR OWN LIVES AND THE HISTORIC DEVELOPMENT OF NEW YORK'S SEAPORT.] [PURPOSE:'THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS&NBSP;TO RETAIN&NBSP;FIVE CORE STAFF POSITIONS, INCLUDING&NBSP;DIRECTOR OF&NBSP;HISTORIC&NBSP;SHIPS,&NBSP;FLEET&NBSP;CAPTAIN,'AND&NBSP;DIRECTOR OF&NBSP;COLLECTIONS,'AND TO CREATE A&NBSP;NEW&NBSP;PUBLIC&NBSP;PROGRAMS&NBSP;MANAGER POSITION,&NBSP;AT&NBSP;THE SOUTH STREET&NBSP;SEAPORT MUSEUM (SSSM)&NBSP;BY SUPPORTING PARTIAL SALARIES FOR THESE POSITIONS.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE&NBSP;PERFORMED:&NBSP;THE PROPOSED FUNDING WOULD SUPPORT ONGOING COLLECTIONS CARE, HISTORIC SHIP PRESERVATION, SCHOOL-AGE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS (IN-PERSON AND VIRTUAL), PRINTING DEMONSTRATIONS AND WORKSHOPS, AND PUBLIC PROGRAMS.&NBSP;THE&NBSP;TEAM&NBSP;BEING RETAINED&NBSP;MANAGES THE CARE OF&NBSP;THE MUSEUM'S&NBSP;PERMANENT AND WORKING COLLECTIONS,&NBSP;THE PRESERVATION AND INTERPRETATION OF&NBSP;HISTORIC VESSELS,&NBSP;THE DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY OF PUBLIC PROGRAMS, SCHOOL-AGE EDUCATION&NBSP;PROGRAMS, AND CURATORIAL RESEARCH.&NBSP;THE&NBSP;DIGITIZATION OF COLLECTIONS&NBSP;WILL ALSO BE ACCOMPLISHED.&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:'THE&NBSP;SSSM&NBSP;WOULD&NBSP;REOPEN, RESTAFF, AND REPROGRAM ITS EXTENSIVE OPERATIONS BY RETAINING KEY STAFF WHO WOULD OVERSEE THE REACTIVATION OF MUSEUM SPACES,'INCLUDING LANDMARKED BUILDINGS AND SHIPS,'WHILE'ADDING A NEW POSITION TO EXPAND PUBLIC PROGRAMS. SUSTAINING'THE CORE&NBSP;KEY&NBSP;POSITIONS IS&NBSP;NECESSARY FOR THE FUNCTIONING OF THE MUSEUM&NBSP;AND&NBSP;ENSURES&NBSP;THE CONTINUATION&NBSP;OF&NBSP;AND EXPANDED'ACCESS TO A VITAL PART OF UNITED STATES MARITIME HISTORY.&NBSP;&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE REOPENING OF THE MUSEUMS BUILDINGS AND HISTORIC SHIPS&NBSP;AS WELL AS THE DIGITIZATION OF COLLECTIONS&NBSP;WOULD BENEFIT&NBSP;SCHOLARS IN VARIOUS DISCIPLINES AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.&NBSP;SCHOOL-AGE STUDENTS AND TEACHERS&NBSP;WILL BENEFIT FROM THE&NBSP;ONGOING EDUCATIONAL&NBSP;PUBLIC PROGRAMS, AS WILL COLLEGE AND ADULT GROUPS WHO ALSO ATTEND&NBSP;EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS.&NBSP;TYPICALLY, THE SSSM HAS&NBSP;50,000 VISITORS AND 12,000 STUDENTS IN A TYPICAL YEAR TO EXPLORE NEW YORK'S MARITIME ORIGINS.&NBSP;&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

VOICES OF OUR PEOPLE: ELDER RECORDING PROJECT [THE TRIBE IS RESPECTFULLY SEEKING SUPPORT FROM THE NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR THE HUMANITIES (NEH) IN THE AMOUNT OF $50,000 TO RECORD THE ORAL HISTORY, TRADITIONAL AND CULTURAL KNOWLEDGE OF THE POTAWATOMI ELDERS IN AN EFFORT TO PRESERVE THIS IRRETRIEVABLE KNOWLEDGE BEFORE IT SLIPS AWAY.] [PURPOSE:'THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS&NBSP;TO'HIRE&NBSP;A TRIBAL CONSULTING&NBSP;SERVICE&NBSP;TO CONDUCT'INTERVIEWS WITH 64 TRIBAL ELDERS&NBSP;AND TO PROVIDE STIPENDS FOR ELDERS WHO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROJECT TOWARDS THE GOAL OF COMPLETING AN EXHIBITION&NBSP;FOR ARCHIVAL PURPOSES.&NBSP;THESE&NBSP;ORAL HISTORIES AUGMENT ARCHAEOLOGICAL AND HISTORICAL WORK BEING DONE&NBSP;AT THE&NBSP;TRIBAL HISTORICAL PRESERVATION OFFICE (THPO).&NBSP;  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: 'THE&NBSP;PROJECT STAFF,&NBSP;AIDED BY&NBSP;A&NBSP;CONSULTING FIRM,&NBSP;WOULD'FORMULATE INTERVIEW CONTENT AND QUESTIONS&NBSP;AND&NBSP;PLAN, FILM, AND PROCESS'64'ORAL'INTERVIEWS WITH TRIBAL ELDERS.'THE SUBJECTS&NBSP;OF THE INTERVIEW&NBSP;WILL&NBSP;INCLUDE&NBSP;THE DISCUSSION OF&NBSP;FOUR SCHOOLS THAT OPERATED ON TRIBAL LANDS BETWEEN THE LATE-NINETEENTH AND MID-TWENTIETH CENTURIES.'&NBSP;&NBSP;  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:' THE&NBSP;ORAL HISTORIES WILL ENHANCE THE CONTENT OF THE CORE EXHIBITION AT THE THPO AND PRESERVE&NBSP;MEMORIES OF TRIBAL ELDERS&NBSP;IN THE ARCHIVES ABOUT&NBSP;SIGNIFICANT&NBSP;SUBJECTS.&NBSP;  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE&NBSP; VIDEOS WILL BECOME PART OF AN EXHIBIT WITH WHICH THE TRIBE'S CULTURAL CENTER, LIBRARY AND MUSEUM&NBSP;AND WILL BENEFIT VISITORS TO THE CENTER&NBSP;AS WELL AS SCHOLARS AND RESEARCHERS INTERESTED IN TRIBAL SCHOOLS&NBSP;AND OTHER TOPICS.&NBSP;  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

SUSTAINING CRITICAL HUMANITIES POSITIONS AT THE STRONG NATIONAL MUSEUM OF PLAY [THE STRONG SEEKS NEH SUPPORT TO FILL FOUR KEY POSITIONS ESSENTIAL TO THE MUSEUM?S ABILITY TO EXECUTE HUMANITIES-FOCUSED OBJECTIVES, FULFILL ITS MISSION, AND SERVE A GROWING AND DIVERSE AUDIENCE OF CHILDREN, ADULTS, SCHOLARS, AND RESEARCHERS WHO DEPEND ON THE STRONG AS THE WORLD?S LEADING RESOURCE ON PLAY. PRESENTING A MORE COMPLETE PICTURE OF SOUTHWESTERN CT?S DIVERSE COLONIAL HISTORY [FAIRFIELD HISTORICAL SOCIETY (DBA FAIRFIELD MUSEUM / FMHC) SEEKS $125,565 TO CREATE A NEW LONG-TERM EXHIBITION EXPLORING CT?S DIVERSE AND COMPLEX 17TH AND 18TH C. HISTORY. THE PROPOSED EXHIBITION WILL PROVIDE VITAL CONTEXT FOR FMHC?S SCHOOL AND COMMUNITY PROGRAMS PLANNED TO COMMEMORATE THE 250TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE IN 2026 BY PRESENTING A MORE COMPLETE HISTORICAL LOOK AT HOW RACE, GENDER, AND CLASS DYNAMICS INFLUENCED THE ESTABLISHMENT OF COLONIAL CONNECTICUT, HOW THOSE FORCES CONTINUE TO REVERBERATE IN CONTEMPORARY SOCIETY, AND HOW CITIZENS TODAY CAN DRAW FROM THOSE PERSPECTIVES TO HELP CREATE A MORE JUST, INCLUSIVE AND SUSTAINABLE SOCIETY FOR THE FUTURE.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS&NBSP;TO HIRE&NBSP;A CURATOR?AND?FUND TWO?CURRENT?STAFF&NBSP;MEMBERS,&NBSP;AS WELL AS HIRE&NBSP;CONTRACTORS?FOR DESIGN AND FABRICATION SERVICES. THE IMPROVEMENTS SHOULD&NBSP;PROVIDE&NBSP;A&NBSP;SCHOLARLY INFORMED&NBSP;INTRODUCTION TO THE REGION'S HISTORY, AS WELL AS AN EXCELLENT PRIMER ON COLONIAL AMERICA IN NEW ENGLAND AS A WHOLE.&NBSP;&NBSP;  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;AUDIENCES, BEFORE THE PANDEMIC, TOTALED?35,000 PEOPLE&NBSP;ANNUALLY&NBSP;WHO&NBSP;VISITED THE FMHC. THESE AUDIENCES WOULD BENEFIT FROM THIS&NBSP;EXHIBITION.&NBSP;OVER&NBSP;4,500 STUDENTS AND TEACHERS ANNUALLY FROM 65 K-12 SCHOOLS&NBSP;WILL TAKE A TOUR OF THE EXHIBITION&NBSP;AND BE OFFERED EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS FOR THEIR GRADE LEVEL.&NBSP;&NBSP;  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

NEH: ARP OLD IDAHO PENITENTIARY [IDAHO STATE HISTORICAL SOCIETY (ISHS), A LEVEL II APPLICANT, IS SEEKING $200,000 IN NEH ARP FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE SALARIES OF SEVEN CRITICAL ISHS HUMANITIES STAFF AS THEY WORK WITH 10 SCHOLAR-ADVISORS AND TWO CONSULTANTS TO CREATE A COMPREHENSIVE INTERPRETIVE AND AUDIENCE DEVELOPMENT PLAN FOR THE OLD IDAHO PENITENTIARY (OLD IDAHO PEN) THROUGH A YEARLONG, INCLUSIVE ENGAGEMENT PROCESS. THE OLD IDAHO PEN WAS PLACED ON THE NATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORICAL PLACES IN 1974 AND IS ONLY ONE OF A HANDFUL OF SUCH HISTORIC SITES IN THE NATION. THE OLD IDAHO PEN HAS MANY STORIES TO TELL, STORIES THAT FASCINATE A NUMBER OF AUDIENCES-CRIME AND PUNISHMENT REFORMERS, ACADEMICS, AND CURIOSITY SEEKERS. DURING THE 12-MONTH PERIOD OF SUPPORT, ISHS STAFF WILL WORK WITH CONSULTANTS AND SCHOLAR-ADVISORS TO IMPLEMENT AN AUDIENCE-CENTRIC DESIGN AND INTERPRETIVE APPROACH BASED ON THE FIELD'S BEST PRACTICES IN CONCEPTUALIZING, PLANNING AND DESIGNING INTERPRETIVE VISITOR EXPERIENCES AT HISTORIC SITES.] [PURPOSE:'THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS&NBSP;TO SUPPORT THE PARTIAL SALARY COMPENSATION FOR'SEVEN STAFF POSITIONS AT THE&NBSP;IDAHO&NBSP;STATE HISTORICAL SOCIETY&NBSP;(ISHS)&NBSP;AND'PROVIDE&NBSP;STIPENDS FOR&NBSP;TEN&NBSP;ADVISORY BOARD MEMBERS AND TWO CONSULTANTS TO DEVELOP AN INTERPRETIVE AND AUDIENCE DEVELOPMENT PLAN FOR THE OLD&NBSP;IDAHO&NBSP;PENITENTIARY&NBSP;(OLD&NBSP;IDAHO&NBSP;PEN)&NBSP;HISTORIC SITE IN BOISE,&NBSP;IDAHO.'&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;STAFF, CONSULTANTS, AND ADVISORS WOULD IMPLEMENT AN AUDIENCE-CENTRIC DESIGN AND INTERPRETIVE APPROACH BASED ON THE FIELD'S BEST PRACTICES IN CONCEPTUALIZING, PLANNING AND DESIGNING INTERPRETIVE EXPERIENCES WITH COMPREHENSIVE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT.'&NBSP;&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE IMPROVEMENTS&NBSP;SHOULD&NBSP;SUPPORT ISHS'S MISSION AND ADVANCE THE HUMANITIES WITH A REFINED VISITOR EXPERIENCE THAT FEATURES THE STORIES OF THE MEN AND WOMEN HOUSED AT THE OLD&NBSP;IDAHO&NBSP;PENITENTIARY, AND&NBSP;IDAHO'S SOCIAL JUSTICE HISTORY THROUGH ITS 30 HISTORIC PRISON BUILDINGS, SUCH AS THE WOMEN'S WARD, SOLITARY CONFINEMENT (SIBERIA), CELL BLOCKS, AND THE GALLOWS.&NBSP;&NBSP; INTENDED&NBSP;BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE&NBSP;OLD&NBSP;IDAHO&NBSP;PEN, WHICH WAS NAMED A NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK IN 1974, DRAWS IN TENS OF THOUSANDS OF TOURISTS AND SCHOOL&NBSP;CHILDREN WHO WALK THROUGH THE&NBSP;BUILDINGS AND YARDS THAT MADE UP THE OLD&NBSP;IDAHO&NBSP;PEN'S COMPLEX. IT REACHES STILL MORE PEOPLE WITH ITS PODCASTS AND VIDEO SEGMENTS POSTED ON YOUTUBE.&NBSP;THESE AUDIENCES WOULD BENEFIT FROM THIS REINTERPRETATION OF THE MUSEUM'S EXHIBITS.&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.]

PUEBLO OF ISLETA YONAN AN CULTURAL CENTER:  CREATING A COMMUNITY-ACCESSIBLE TRIBAL ARCHIVE [IN 2020, THE PUEBLO OF ISLETA OPENED THE YONAN AN CULTURAL CENTER. FOCUSING UPON A RANGE OF CREATIVE COMMUNITY-BASED KNOWLEDGE-SHARING PRACTICES, A CENTRAL FOCUS OF THE WORK WE DO HERE AT YONAN AN IS THE CREATION OF AN ACCESSIBLE, COLLABORATIVE, LIVING TRIBAL ARCHIVE. NEH ARP FUNDS WILL BE USED TO RETAIN KEY STAFF, PROVIDE TRAINING, FACILITATE PROGRAMMING, AND PURCHASE EQUIPMENT NECESSARY TO FULFILL THIS GOAL.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT&NBSP;IS TO RETAIN THE&NBSP;ARCHIVIST FOR THE?YONAN?AN CULTURAL CENTER?AND&NBSP;TO HIRE&NBSP;A?TIWA?LANGUAGE SCHOLAR,?AN ARCHIVAL?CONSULTANT,?AND?PROVIDE&NBSP;STIPENDS FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS AS WELL AS MATERIALS AND SUPPLIES?TO?FACILITATE CULTURALLY APPROPRIATE ARCHIVAL?ACTIVITIES AT?THE PUEBLO OF ISLETA ARCHIVE.?&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:?THESE STAFF MEMBERS WILL&NBSP;ENGAGE IN?MULTIPLE ARCHIVE-BASED ACTIVITIES?INCLUDING&NBSP;THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY-ACCESSIBLE DIGITAL ARCHIVE, COMPLETE?DIGITAL ARCHIVES TRAINING FOR?ARCHIVE?STAFF,?PURCHASE MATERIALS AND SUPPLIES NECESSARY TO?THE ARCHIVE?S?SUCCESSFUL OPERATION, COMPLETE&NBSP;A DIGITAL?AND PHYSICAL?PRESERVATION ASSESSMENT,?AND&NBSP;DEVELOP?COMMUNITY-ORIENTED?PROGRAMMING.?OBJECTS TO BE PRESERVED AND DIGITIZED INCLUDE:&NBSP;HISTORICAL?PHOTOGRAPHS, MAPS, INTERVIEWS, SITE REPORTS, AND OTHER RECORDS OF CULTURAL AND HISTORICAL SIGNIFICANCE&NBSP;TO THE&NBSP;TRIBAL?COMMUNITY.&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:&NBSP;THE IMPROVEMENTS&NBSP;AND ACTIVITIES WOULD&NBSP;PROVIDE LONG-TERM STORAGE AND ACCESS TO COMMUNITY RECORDS AND&NBSP;POSSIBLY&NBSP;PROVIDE A MODEL OF TRIBAL CONTROL OVER RECORDS.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE&NBSP;MATERIALS WOULD BENEFIT MEMBERS OF THE PUEBLO OF ISLETA, SCHOLARS, RESEARCHERS, AND VISITORS TO THE&NBSP;YONAN?AN CULTURAL CENTER AND PUEBLO OF ISLETA ARCHIVE,?OPENED IN 2020,?AND WOULD ALSO BENEFIT THOSE WHO ACCESS THE MATERIAL ONLINE.&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

OPEN DREAMSVILLE, USA:  EXTEND ACCESS TO THE DENNISON RAILROAD DEPOT MUSEUM, NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK [DENNISON, OH WAS NICKNAMED DREAMSVILLE USA BY WWII SOLDIERS THAT STOPPED AT THE DENNISON CANTEEN BECAUSE THE SERVICE THEY RECEIVED WAS LIKE A DREAM COME TRUE. IN 2011, OUR DEPOT BECAME A NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK AS THE BEST EXAMPLE LEFT IN THE NATION OF A WWII HOMEFRONT CANTEEN. SINCE 1989, OUR MUSEUM HAS BEEN OPEN TO THE PUBLIC WITH A FULL CALENDAR OF EVENTS, PROGRAMS AND EXHIBITS 6 DAYS A WEEK, YEAR ROUND. HOWEVER, THE PANDEMIC CAUSED A DEVASTATING ADVERSE EFFECT ON OUR LANDMARK, GREATLY LIMITING PUBLIC ACCESS DUE TO A FORCED CLOSURE AND LOST REVENUE. WE LOST OF ALL SCHOOL AND BUS TOURS, SPECIAL EVENTS, PROGRAMS AND FUNDRAISERS. WE HAVE BEEN FORCED TO CUT OR LAYOFF STAFF AND SHORTEN HOURS OF OPERATIONS. THIS HAS TREMENDOUSLY REDUCED HUMANITIES PROGRAMMING AND PRESERVATION EFFORTS ON OUR SIGNIFICANT FACILITIES LEFT WITH ONLY A SKELETON CREW IN PLACE. WITH THESE GRANT DOLLARS, WE WILL BE ABLE TO RESTORE OUR STAFF, REOPEN ACCESS AGAIN AND BRING OUR FOCUS BACK ON TO OUR MISSION] [PURPOSE:'THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO RETAIN&NBSP;FIVE'STAFF&NBSP;MEMBERS -&NBSP;EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, ACTING CURATOR AND REGISTRAR, SPECIAL PROJECTS COORDINATOR, MARKETING AND SOCIAL MEDIA COORDINATOR, AND THE MANAGER OF FRONTLINE EXPERIENCE&NBSP;' TO CONTINUE THE&NBSP;OPERATION OF A MUSEUM PRESENTING AND INTERPRETING THE HISTORY OF THE LAST REMAINING HOMEFRONT'CANTEEN'WHERE OVER 1.5 MILLION SOLDIERS WERE SERVED DURING WORLD'WAR'II.''&NBSP;  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: '&NBSP;DAILY OPERATIONS WILL RESUME TO MAINTAIN THE&NBSP;ARTIFACT AND ARCHIVAL COLLECTION,&NBSP;CONTINUE&NBSP;PRESERVATION&NBSP;AND CONSERVATION,&NBSP;CONTINUE&NBSP;OUTREACH AND&NBSP;ON-SITE&NBSP;EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES,&NBSP;AND MAINTAIN&NBSP;EXHIBITIONS AND INTERPRETATION&NBSP;AT THE MUSEUM.&NBSP;THE FEATURE EXHIBIT SCHEDULE WITH ACCOMPANYING&NBSP;PROGRAMMING&NBSP;WILL RESTART.&NBSP;  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:' THE&NBSP;GRANT WILL&NBSP;SUPPORT THE MAINTENANCE OF THE MUSEUM, PARTICULARLY ALLOWING IT TO RETAIN QUALIFIED AND DEDICATED&NBSP;PERSONNEL WHILE THE MUSEUM GETS BACK TO ITS REVENUE-GENERATING OPERATIONS.'THE MUSEUM WILL CONTINUE ITS&NBSP;MISSION TO COLLECT, PRESERVE, EXHIBIT AND INTERPRET THE HISTORY OF RAILROAD AND WWII HERITAGE&NBSP;AT THE SITE.&NBSP; &NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE AUDIENCES&NBSP;WHO BENEFIT FROM&NBSP;THIS MUSEUM INCLUDE SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN AND TEACHERS,&NBSP;VISITORS TO THE HISTORY LOOP, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC&NBSP;WHO VISIT THE DEPOT.&NBSP;&NBSP;  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:'THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

THE GENIUS OF PLACE: IMAGES OF GARDENS AND LANDSCAPES FROM AMERICA AND AROUND THE WORLD 1920-1984 [THROUGH THIS ONE-YEAR PROJECT, WE WILL IMPROVE ACCESS TO AND PRESERVE THREE VALUABLE COLLECTIONS RELATED TO THE HISTORY OF GARDENING, LANDSCAPE DESIGN, AND HORTICULTURE BETWEEN 1920 TO 1984. AN ESTIMATED 2100 ITEMS WILL BE DIGITIZED, CATALOGUED, OR REHOUSED, OR A COMBINATION OF ALL THREE TASKS. PRESENTATIONS OF THE ITEMS TO A VARIETY OF AUDIENCES WILL TELL THE STORY OF THE EVOLUTION OF GARDENING AND URBAN GREENING EFFORTS. THESE THREE COLLECTIONS TOGETHER PROVIDE RARE AND INTRIGUING GLIMPSES INTO THE HISTORY OF GARDENING PRACTICES AND LANDSCAPES IN U.S AND AROUND THE WORLD. HARE LANTERN SLIDE COLLECTION?AS WELL AS?MATERIALS FROM THE?NEIGHBORHOOD GARDENS ASSOCIATION OF PHILADELPHIA?AND?THE PHILADELPHIA GREEN PROGRAM.&NBSP;WEBINAR PROGRAMS WILL ALSO BE DEVELOPED.&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THIS DIGITIZATION PROJECT&NBSP;SHOULD&NBSP;FULFILL&NBSP;THE ONGOING NEED TO SERVE RESEARCHERS AND LOCAL CONSTITUENTS THROUGH DIGITAL MEANS.&NBSP;THE WEBINAR PROGRAMS WILL EDUCATE AUDIENCES ABOUT THE HISTORY OF GARDENING.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:&NBSP;THE PROJECT WOULD SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE PUBLIC ACCESS TO THE HISTORY OF PHILADELPHIA HORTICULTURE&NBSP;AND&NBSP;URBAN GARDENING. PRESERVING HUMANITIES POSITIONS FOR CONSERVATION OF HUMANITIES COLLECTIONS [FINANCIAL SUPPORT WILL ENSURE CONTINUANCE OF TWO PROGRAMS THAT ARE KEY TO PRESERVING HUMANITIES COLLECTIONS IN THE U.S. FAIC?S NATIONAL HERITAGE RESPONDERS (NHR) IS A NATIONAL NETWORK OF VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE SPECIALLY TRAINED TO RESPOND TO EMERGENCIES INVOLVING CULTURAL COLLECTIONS. INCLUSIVE HISTORY AT SANTA MONICA HISTORY MUSEUM [CONSIDERING INEQUITIES FURTHER MAGNIFIED DURING THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC AND THE RACE EQUITY MOVEMENT, SANTA MONICA HISTORY MUSEUM DETERMINED IT WAS TIME FOR US TO DECISIVELY ACT BY TAKING LARGE, TANGIBLE, VISIBLE STEPS AS A CULTURAL LEADER OF THE CITY OF SANTA MONICA AND ENSURE A CONTINUITY OF CULTURAL CARE FOR OUR COMMUNITY DESPITE THE DISRUPTIONS DUE TO THE PANDEMIC. MUSEUM ACCESSIONING AND REGISTRATION OF COLLECTIONS ONLINE COURSE FOR RURAL AND ISOLATED MUSEUMS (MARC ONLINE) [THE MUSEUM ACCESSIONING AND REGISTRATION OF COLLECTIONS (MARC) COURSE, DEVELOPED BY THE OKLAHOMA MUSEUMS ASSOCIATION (OMA) HISTORICALLY HAS BEEN OFFERED AS AN IN-PERSON TWO-DAY COURSE, BUT DUE TO THE PANDEMIC, OMA PLANS TO CONVERT IT TO AN ONLINE COURSE. OMA BELIEVES THE ONLINE FORMAT WILL MAKE THE INFORMATION MORE ACCESSIBLE, ESPECIALLY TO RURAL AND ISOLATED MUSEUMS, COLLECTING LIBRARIES AND ARCHIVES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. THIS COURSE TEACHES A SOLID FOUNDATION OF BASIC MUSEUM COLLECTIONS KNOWLEDGE. MARC IS GREAT FOR STAFF WORKING WITH MUSEUM COLLECTIONS, ARTIFACT DONATIONS, EXHIBIT LOANS, AND MUCH MORE. THE MARC COURSE WILL COVER MISSION STATEMENTS, CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, ETHICS, COLLECTIONS MANAGEMENT POLICIES, COLLECTING PLANS, COLLECTIONS COMMITTEES, AND LEGAL ISSUES RELATING TO MUSEUM COLLECTIONS AND DEACCESSIONING AS WELL AS THE PROCESS OF ARTIFACT DONATIONS INCLUDING DOCUMENTATION, THE PHYSICAL APPLICATION OF A NUMBER AND MORE.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT FOUR POSITIONS INVOLVED IN THE PRODUCTION OF A FREE, ONLINE COURSE FOR MUSEUM PROFESSIONALS?ADDRESSING FUNDAMENTALS OF?MUSEUM COLLECTIONS?MANAGEMENT.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE STAFF WOULD BE INVOLVED IN PRODUCING, PROMOTING, AND EVALUATING A CLOSED-CAPTIONED ONLINE VERSION OF A MUSEUM ACCESSIONING AND REGISTRATION OF COLLECTIONS (MARC) COURSE FOR RURAL AND ISOLATED MUSEUMS COMPRISED OF?TEN?60-MINUTE VIDEOS.?&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THE&NBSP;EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TEN 60-MINUTE VIDEOS TO BE POSTED ON THE&NBSP;OKLAHOMA&NBSP;MUSEUM ASSOCIATION?S&NBSP;YOUTUBE&NBSP;CHANNEL&NBSP;CONTAINING THE ENTIRETY OF THE MARC COURSE.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE&NBSP;AUDIENCE&NBSP;WHICH&NBSP;WOULD&NBSP;BENEFIT FROM THIS&NBSP;COMPREHENSIVE&NBSP;COURSE&NBSP;BEING AVAILABLE ONLINE WOULD&NBSP;BE&NBSP;RURAL AND ISOLATED MUSEUMS, AS WELL AS COLLECTING LIBRARIES AND ARCHIVES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF&NBSP;OKLAHOMA,&NBSP;OR ANY&NBSP;MUSEUM PROFESSIONAL&NBSP;WHO WANTS TO LEARN AND USE BEST PRACTICES FOR THEIR COLLECTIONS.&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.?&NBSP;]

DIGITIZING ASSORTED COLLECTIONS [DIGITIZE AND PROVIDE ONLINE ACCESS FOR THREE COLLECTIONS IN YIVO'S ARCHIVES: VILNA TERRITORIAL COLLECTION; RECORDS OF THE LITHUANIAN JEWISH COMMUNITY COUNCIL; AND THE JEWISH CUSTOMS COLLECTIONS] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO&NBSP;RETAIN FIVE STAFF MEMBERS ??THE&NBSP;DIRECTOR OF&NBSP;ARCHIVES,&NBSP;THE&NBSP;DIGITAL&NBSP;LAB&NBSP;MANAGER, TWO&NBSP;DIGITAL&NBSP;PROJECTS&NBSP;SPECIALISTS, AND&NBSP;A&NBSP;DIGITAL&NBSP;PROCESSING&NBSP;ARCHIVIST.&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE&NBSP;PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE&NBSP;DIGITIZING&NBSP;AND PROVIDING&NBSP;ONLINE ACCESS TO THE VILNA TERRITORIAL COLLECTION, THE RECORDS OF THE LITHUANIAN JEWISH COMMUNITY COUNCIL, AND THE JEWISH CUSTOMS COLLECTION, AS WELL AS MAKING AVAILABLE ONLINE WORKS RELATING TO AMERICAN YIDDISH LITERATURE, THE CHAIM GRADE COLLECTION, AND?SIGNIFICANT&NBSP;RECORD&NBSP;ALBUMS.?&NBSP; EXPECTED OUTCOMES:?THE DIGITIZATION SHOULD PROVIDE ACCESS TO 70,000 PAGES FROM THE VILNA TERRITORIAL COLLECTION,&NBSP;THE RECORDS OF THE LITHUANIAN JEWISH COMMUNITY COUNCIL, AND THE JEWISH CUSTOMS COLLECTION,&NBSP;500 DIGITIZED 78&NBSP;RPM RECORD&NBSP;ALBUMS,&NBSP;AND&NBSP;2,500 YIDDISH BOOKS PUBLISHED BETWEEN THE 1880S AND 1920S.&NBSP; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE&NBSP;INCREASED&NBSP;ACCESS&NBSP;TO THESE HISTORIC&NBSP;DIGITIZED&NBSP;MATERIALS&NBSP;WOULD BENEFIT&NBSP;SCHOLARS, THE GENERAL PUBLIC,&NBSP;PEOPLE&NBSP;INTERESTED IN GENEALOGICAL RESEARCH, AUDIENCES OF THE&NBSP;SMITHSONIAN AFFILIATE NETWORK OF MORE THAN 200 ORGANIZATIONS&NBSP;OF&NBSP;WHICH YIVO IS A PART, AND OTHERS.&NBSP; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:?THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.&NBSP;]

VERMONT'S ROLE IN OUR NATIONAL STORY: PROVIDING DIGITAL ACCESS TO OUR COLLECTIONS [VHS IS ASKING FOR ADDITIONAL RELIEF FUNDING FROM NEH TO SUPPORT THE CREATION OF DIGITAL CATALOG RECORDS TO MAKE VERMONT HISTORY ACCESSIBLE FROM ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD. VHS SERVES THOUSANDS OF STUDENTS AND TEACHERS ANNUALLY, WHO RELY ON ACCESS TO PRIMARY SOURCE MATERIALS TO MEET CURRICULUM STANDARDS. RESEARCHERS RELY ON DIGITAL ACCESS TO THE RARE AND UNIQUE ITEMS PRESERVED IN OUR ARCHIVES TO PROMOTE SCHOLARSHIP ON VERMONT HISTORY AND CURRENT EVENTS. SINCE THE BEGINNING OF THE PANDEMIC, WE HAVE SEEN A DISTINCT INCREASE IN THE USE OF OUR DIGITAL COLLECTIONS, ESPECIALLY BY THOSE LIVING OUTSIDE VERMONT. TO COMMEMORATE AMERICA'S 250TH ANNIVERSARY, WE WILL PRIORITIZE ACCESS TO COLLECTIONS FROM VERMONT'S COLONIAL PERIOD AND THOSE HIGHLIGHTING THE UNIQUE EXPERIENCES OF UNDER-REPRESENTED COMMUNITIES. THIS PROJECT WILL BUILD ON OUR INITIAL ACCOMPLISHMENTS AND PROVIDE ACCESS TO COLLECTIONS THAT INFORM OUR UNDERSTANDING OF VERMONT'S ROLE IN OUR NATIONAL STORY.] [PURPOSE:?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO RETAIN FIVE FULL-TIME POSITIONS AND FOUR PART-TIME POSITIONS TO ENGAGE IN COLLECTION DESCRIPTION,?PRESERVATION, DATABASE?MANAGEMENT, AND DIGITIZATION&NBSP;AT THE VERMONT HISTORICAL SOCIETY (VHS).?&NBSP; ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:&NBSP;STAFF PLAN&NBSP;TO INVENTORY&NBSP;AND MAINTAIN&NBSP;COLLECTIONS,?CREATE CATALOG RECORDS,&NBSP;AND&NBSP;WRITE&NBSP;COLLECTION DESCRIPTIONS.&NBSP;COLLECTION DESCRIPTION&NBSP;ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:&NBSP;FINDING OCLC RECORDS FOR NEWLY ACQUIRED MATERIALS AND LONG-HELD MATERIALS (RETROSPECTIVE CONVERSION); LOADING NEW RECORDS IN&NBSP;THEIR&NBSP;ONLINE PUBLIC ACCESS CATALOG (OPAC)&NBSP;WHERE RESEARCHERS CAN ACCESS THEM; REVIEWING RETROSPECTIVE RECORDS TO MAKE THEM CONSISTENT WITH&NBSP;THEIR&NBSP;OPAC, CREATING ORIGINAL CATALOGING RECORDS FOR NEW AND OLD LIBRARY AND MUSEUM ACQUISITIONS; CREATING AND REVIEWING FINDING AIDS OF MANUSCRIPT COLLECTIONS; AND CREATING AND REVIEWING MACHINE READABLE CATALOGING (MARC) RECORDS FOR MANUSCRIPT COLLECTIONS, BEFORE UPLOADING THEM INTO OCLC AND&NBSP;THEIR&NBSP;OPAC.&NBSP;THEY WILL ALSO ADD&NBSP;EXISTING CATALOG ENTRIES IN THEIR OPAC AND&NBSP;CATALOGIT&NBSP;DATABASES.&NBSP;COLLECTIONS&NBSP;MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: UNPACKING OBJECTS FROM WHEN VHS MOVED TO ITS CURRENT LOCATION IN 2000, REHOUSING OBJECTS FOR EASIER ACCESSIBILITY AND BETTER PREVENTATIVE CONSERVATION, AND EVALUATING OBJECTS? RELEVANCE TO THE VHS?S MISSION. NMHC EMERGENCY SUPPLEMENT [THE NEW MEXICO HUMANITIES COUNCIL (NMHC) HAS REQUESTED EMERGENCY SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $30,000 TO SUPPORT ASSESSMENT AND PLANNING IN RESPONSE TO WILDFIRES THAT ARE CAUSING CATASTROPHIC DAMAGE ACROSS MUCH OF NORTHERN NEW MEXICO. IF APPROVED, THE EMERGENCY FUNDING WOULD BE ISSUED AS A SUPPLEMENT TO NMHC?S GENERAL OPERATING SUPPORT AWARD (SO-268668-20) WITH A SPECIAL IDENTIFICATION NUMBER FOR TRACKING.

ON MAY 4, 2022, PRESIDENT BIDEN ISSUED A FEDERAL DISASTER DECLARATION FOR THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO IN THE AREAS AFFECTED BY WILDFIRES IN COLFAX, LINCOLN, MORA, SAN MIGUEL, AND VALENCIA COUNTIES. THE DISASTER ZONE INCLUDES AREAS OF UNIQUE HISTORICAL AND CULTURAL SIGNIFICANCE INCLUDING COMMUNITIES THAT ARE HOME TO COMPLEX, CENTURIES-OLD, INDO-HISPANO CULTURES.

NMHC WOULD USE THE SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING TO SUPPORT AN ASSESSMENT AND DISASTER RESPONSE PLAN. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE OUTREACH TO CULTURAL HERITAGE ORGANIZATIONS, TRIBAL ORGANIZATIONS, PUBLIC HUMANISTS, AND CULTURE/TRADITION BEARERS OF THE AFFECTED AREAS; FOUR PUBLIC INFORMATION-GATHERING ROUNDTABLE DISCUSSIONS HELD NEAR THE AFFECTED AREAS; ONLINE SURVEYS; AND CONVENINGS WITH OTHER STATE CULTURAL LEADERS, INCLUDING THE MANITOS COMMUNITY MEMORY PROJECT, NEW MEXICO HIGHLANDS UNIVERSITY, AND THE NEW MEXICO DEPARTMENT OF CULTURAL AFFAIRS, TO COORDINATE ASSESSMENT AND PLANNING ACTIVITIES. FINDINGS FROM THE ASSESSMENT WILL BE SHARED WITH NEH AND WILL INFORM NMHC?S RESPONSE PLAN. THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE WILL BEGIN JUNE 1, 2022, AND CONCLUDE SEPTEMBER 30, 2022; COSTS MAY BE INCURRED DATING BACK TO MAY 4, 2022, THE DAY OF THE PRESIDENT?S DISASTER DECLARATION.]
